Reviews.Title: “It was shambles from start to finishits not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: cameoikoka
Reviews.Content: We asked for a cot, there was none broken furniture with nails hangin out no hot water for at least a day blow dryer never worked for more then 10 secs not happy at all 14 â‚¬ breakfast was not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Best western made bad by staff attitudes”
Reviews.Author: shoehorn79
Reviews.Content: We booked a room from 24th to 28th March as we were staying in amsterdam for a short break. We were not happy at all with our service from the guys at this hotel. In fact this was our worst trip. We arrived on the saturday morning and were able to check in early which we thought was great. As we weren't supposed to check in until 2pm it was an added bonus for us so we could drop our luggage off. When we checked in we were in a room that was still not cleaned from the night before. The beds weren't made and it was obvious someone had been smoking in the room, so we left our bags there and assumed this would be cleaned. We went about our day into amsterdam. As we returned at around 4pm, our room was still in the same condition and we were disgusted that this had happened. We reported this to the receptionist who apologised and promised to get it sorted and told us to come back in two hours. we went away and returned within an hour as we had no where else to go where we were staying. We were tired and weary from the travelling and it been a long day. We were left to wait in the reception and was ignored by the reception staff. After an hour and a half i thought id go and check the room. It turns out it had been cleaned but no one had bothered to tell us At this point i was angry with the receptionist who said she would alert us as to then the room was ready. The receptionist then started to argue back with me which i was appalled at. It got to the point where i had to tell the receptionist we would be making a complaint. After asking for details on how to do this, she replied 'the details are on your keycard' which to me made it clear she couldn't be bothered to help us in anyway whatsoever. It was the worst start to our holiday and the fact the receptionist argued back with me just topped it off. I couldn't believe we were treated like this. Bearing in mind how much money we had spent on the hotel i was appalled by the overall experience we received in this hotel which is shame because the facilities were nice and the breakfast buffet was also great. Dont try and check in early and be prepared to walk into town. Its 3 and a half miles which is ok on a nice sunny day

Reviews.Title: “Standard Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiki4321
Reviews.Content: Good sized room, clean, standard chain hotel. Good selection for breakfast. Close to tram/bus stops into the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars hotel, maybe 3...”
Reviews.Author: IreneFraser
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a couple of nights trip to Amsterdam and I chose this hotel because I found a very good deal online and the reviews I read here weren't too bad. Well, it's exactly that, an average hotel. It's clean enough, with spacious rooms and a so so breakfast. The reception staff weren't the most attentive but friendly enough I guess. Don't expect much info from them though. The best I can say it's the price we got. As if paying more I would have been quite disappointed. There is no way it's a 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “blue tower hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eoin R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel,we booked with easytobook.com,would not recommend this website as it lead us to believe the hotel was only a few minutes from Amsterdam centre when infact it is half an hour..We also requested a double bed and got twin beds as the website gave the wrong info to the hotel which was an inconvenience..I would recommend a closer hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with good transport links”
Reviews.Author: burnie100
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is full of bad hotels, so this one is a nice find. It's not far from central as the crow flies, but around the corner from great transport links, as well as the night bus stop. You can get to the Leidseplein in 15 minutes, as well as Dam Square, on the frequently running trams. A taxi is â‚¬20 to central or less. The rooms are nice with lots of heavy wood furniture and very comfortable beds. Some rooms even have underfloor heating in the bathrooms. You get free wifi and there are 2 free computers in the lobby if you don't have your own. breakfast is nice. It's just a pleasant place to stay. It is next to a mall with 2 large grocery stores and a few shops. The area is predominately moslem, so there are some good kebab shops and bakeries in the area. I found it nicer than staying in the central part of amsterdam, and if you have a car, there is a multi storey parking lot beside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: roni k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice Very good breakfest Friendl and helpfull stuff Free wifi worked well Location about 10 minutes by tram to centre But no problem as tram station 2 minutes walk from hotel Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Average Hotel - Not So Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ParulVirenKhanna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean and they advise very well on the tours and places to visit. Public transport is just across the road.So that makes up for the far off location. The food in the hotel is not too great but there are lots of fast food options available. Plus local food joints which are great. We were given a room on the top floor and to our dismay the elevator only went till one floor below so we dragged the heavy luggage up the stairs (and we dont travel light) with great difficultly.But managed.the room size was great by europe standareds.And the bathrooms clean and big. The internet center near the reception came in handly. The staff was very helpful and added to our experience

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel, no 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: Wiver
Reviews.Content: In general one could say that the hotel needs some renovation inside. Full carpet in all rooms is a bit behind times. Our room on the 2nd floor had a stuffy smell, although it was cleaned well. Room was spacious and beds were super! Free wifi worked well. P+R carpark with direct entrance to the hotel was comfortable. We reached the very city centre by public transport in ca. 15-20 minutes. Staff was friendly, very helpful and effective. A problem with the safe was solved in no time. BUT: breakfast on saturday was disastrous. Too many people, not enough tables and seats... Hot dishes were cold, out of food and drinks. Chaos everywhere. A pity!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Laurcolm
Reviews.Content: Rooms were super clean and beds were quite comfy. Free wifi in rooms was very handy. Like most "matrimonial" beds in Europe - these were two twin beds pushed together but it was still very comfy. The lifts to the rooms were slightly slow which could be annoying when a big group of people was trying to get upstairs. There are supermarkets and restaurants conveniently close. Breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Lifesaving hotel of an unbelievable standard”
Reviews.Author: Danroycarter
Reviews.Content: Having had a nightmare experience the previous night with a 'cheap and cheerful' hotel in the centre, Blue Tower was one of the few hotels not too far from the centre whilst I was visiting on business. The receptionist was incredibly helpful (not to mention sympathetic) in sorting us a last minute room and quite frankly, we payed half the price for an incredibly convenient and comfortable hotel. The beds were great and the rooms were warm and came with all the commodities you would expect. Despite the change in location, staff were happy to direct us via tourist maps and write out precise directions to the venues we needed to attend. The hotel is easily accessible by the city's Tram services, which proved a very cost-effective method of travel compared to taxis. In short - great hotel, great staff, reasonable last minute price and not a bad location either.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasent Stay at Blue Tower!”
Reviews.Author: ABSEssex
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a weekend away in Amsterdam and stayed at the Blue Tower. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted with a pleasent member of staff. We actually arrived at 10am before the official check in at 2pm but they still let us check in to our rooms. Bonus! Not only that they upgraded both rooms to superior free of charge! A further bonus! Rooms were nice, very comfy beds and ensuite (There was even floor warming in the bathroom). Yes - The location is in a residential area but this did not bother us at all. We had a couple of supermarkets and KFC 2 mins away from us which was very handy. The ride into dam square is around 15 minutes and cost us between 13-15 euros. There were four us so it didnt work out that much. The taxi to and from airport is around 40 euros which is a slight rip off as it is only 20 mins away from hotel but what can you do! All in all a very enjoyable stay. Do not listen to bad reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clogheen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in room 714,,, Very good sized room and on-suite, very clean and warm, beds very comfortable, staff very friendly and welcoming, breakfast delish. :-) with plenty of choice,,,smoked bacon was to die for,,,plenty of fresh fruit,,,various breads,,,and cereal,,cold meats and cheese ! This Hotel is only ten minutes from the centre of Amsterdam and Trams run every ten minutes,,,number 14 and 7, although this Hotel is in a residential area I felt very secure when out and about even at night ! We booked this Hotel with Travelsoon.com and got a very good deal @ Â£109 PP Bed and Breakfast including flights, Take the number 21 Bus from Central station,,you have to go across the road to get your ticket if you want a 48 hour pass,,costing 24 Euro for two,,great for hopping on and off trams/ busses, Goggle the area before you go for all tram and bus routes,,,and print some off,,,really helps in the first day ! We will be returning to Amsterdam and will be using this Hotel again :-)

Reviews.Title: “For the traveller who travels.”
Reviews.Author: cardtable
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Tower for 4 nights. For those seeking excellent value for their money and are not afraid of travelling with the locals into the city centre this is highly recommended. The hotel is on tram line 14, which is the only travel to go through the north side of the dam as every other tram nearby goes to the left or right hand side of the square. Make sure you get off at Bos en Lommerplein and not Bos en Lommerweg which is 2 stops beforehand. The hotel itself is purpose built and not a converted town house with the usual steep stairs. Here you get elevators and en suite bathrooms. Room had the basics. Hairdryer, tea facilties, free tv and extra pay tv. No fridge though. The free tv also had two 24 hour porn channels to make it an authentic amsterdam experience (hahaha) Outside the hotel was a square with 2 supermarkets and many shops. Every day we seen the market full of stalls selling hot food, fruit, veg, clothes etc. Worth a look around before you head out for the day. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay and would come here again. Good value for moeny and a chance to see the real amsterdam away from the usual cannabis shops and other touristy places.

Reviews.Title: “Good cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: YouSeeShah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my business trip. This hotel is decent. Overall hotel looks fine. Room was clean and spacious. Location of the hotel is not good. It taken an effort to find the location. Breakfast options are decent and food is also good. Did not like smell from kitchen spreading around elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel and hope to go back soon”
Reviews.Author: MSmiths S
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying in this hotel and I can say its nice to have a repeat experience. The hotel is located in a residential area about 10-15 mins by tram from historical city center. Staff at reception are efficient and the rooms are spacious and great. Great size bed, bright and warm...love the bathroom, convinient and nice shower. Breakfast has a great choice. Self service and coffee machine on hand with good quality coffee. We had dinner and it was superb. Service was professional and very hospitable. Overall a great hotel, not pricey for Amsterdam standards......so recommend this hotel and hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and nice Business Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Medo4u
Reviews.Content: A clean and nice Business Hotel. Nothing romantic but good standard rooms. Excellent location close to highway and 10 min drive to go downtown with a taxi. Service personnel was friendly but nothing to get overly excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katalin G
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Amsterdam and my friend made reservations to this hotel through another web site Easybooking.com. It was advertised as being close to Central Station. It is nowhere near the centrum. After realizing that we were hoodwinked, we reluctantly checked in and the hotel staff ignored us for the first 10 minutes. We informed them about our displeasure about being misled about the location and they were disinterested in hearing what we had to say. After prepaying for two nights (a common practice in Europe) we went to our room where it was dusty, the phone continually fell off of the wall when one walked by,and the bathroom was tiny with the toilet tightly situated between tub and the wall. After discussing our options we decided to leave and find another hotel. The manager tried to get us to stay at another Best Western for more money, but we were uninterested. We asked the manager to refund our credit card and the manager refused. He gave us excuse after excuse as to why he could not do that and eventually he told us he was only concerned about getting his commission. He was perfectly content to allow his customers to be extremely unhappy rather than assist in any way. At one point all three of us were arguing with him to just credit our credit card and he continually refused. He actually looked at me and said "I learned a long time ago not to trust anyone with pretty blue eyes." We eventually cancelled our reservation through Easy Booking and left with the understanding that he would refund us our 300 euros. The money was not refunded until we arrived back in the U.S. and they only refunded us half of the money owed. I have traveled all over the world and understand that customer service is defined differently wherever one travels, but this was truly the worst service I have ever received and actually felt this hotel was holding our money hostage. As it stands, these people are nothing more the thieves taking advantage of false and misleading advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Dollyfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and received a complimentary upgrade to an executive room on the 11th floor, so I think we got a very nice room. We had lots of space and a panoramic view of the area which was not exactly scenic, but a view none the less. The accommodations were very comfortable including the heated tile floor in the spacious bathroom. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. We had the breakfast buffet all 3 days which was very good in a modern setting. We did not use the restaurant for any other meals but the menu looked very interesting, although pricey. The hotel is located in a mainly residential area with not very many restaurants to chose from and is about 10-15 minutes by bus/tram to downtown, which we did not find a big problem, but would probably stay closer to downtown if returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Manageable .. Just about..”
Reviews.Author: ajay069
Reviews.Content: Had a group accommodated at the hotel very recently .. I will share the positives and negatives. Clean, good rooms.. For European standards rooms sizes were quite good. Housekeeping was efficient. Staff were usually helpful.. Rutger, Niki were great help. The GM , Martin Van Noord was wonderfully cooperative . Sorted our rooming list bungles though a guest had to wait for about 1 hour. They also accommodated all our early check ins for which I am very indebted to them. Rooms usually have the ring-road view and the higher floors usually have better rooms. There is the Albert Heijn supermarket at 2 mins walk from the hotel so this is convenient for any supplies. The area is residential and there are a few shops around. supposedly an immigrant area but this was not an issue. Now the not so pleasant part.. same breakfast for 5 days .. Very difficult for all the 5 days to consume .. Limited variety. Outside city centre but Tram 14 and tram 7 are walking distance from the hotel and trams run every 10-15 mins and take 15 mins to city Centre.. Dam square/Ieidesplein. No minibar or room service.. if at all there is no room service menu??No water provided in the rooms. I would say a 3 star + hotel at best but not 4* surely though they have been graded 4* by the local hotel association. doors shut at 11 p.m and you have to ring the bell outside to be let in but I did not personally experience this. If you can get a better 4* city center this would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: Dawn135
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is out of the centre and in a residential area but we found it very clean. We also were on the 11th floor so had the trouble of getting the lift to the 10th and walking up the stairs but how many times a day do you do that realistically for it to be a problem...? The market at the back of the hotel had some real bargains - my teenage daughter got really trendy shoes for 13 euro and thermal leggings for 2 euro - and the tram stop was very handy - only 2.60 euro into the town centre - I would recommend buying a travel card if you're there for a few days rather than pay each journey - works out cheaper. We found the hotel very clean and the breakfast was fantastic - bacon, egg and mushrooms, or cereal, or ham/cheese, croissants, rolls, fruit juice, tea, coffee - not sure what more you could want! We found the reception staff more than helpful - we asked for milk one evening and were given a litre. We also got them to book our taxi for the trip to the airport when leaving - again, very friendly and helpful. Taxi to or from the airport works out at around 40 euro. Take the little discount cards located on the first floor at the lift - they do work. We got discount on the canal cruise and the ice bar. Tip if you go to the ice bar - do NOT sit at the front when they show the video - they blow freezing cold air as part of the 4D experience and its minus 10 in there already!! Canal cruise is lovely and because you can hop on hop off its a very easy relaxing way to see the whole city - there are four different routes distinguished by colour and you can go on any combination of these. We found the city to be very clean apart from the Red Light district which had a lot of litter. My one regret is that we didnt have time to visit the Museum of Bags and Purses because I'm a handbag freak...but maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: JARBoston
Reviews.Content: My company got a "good deal" on this hotel during a trade show in Amsterdam it was a big disappointment. The hotel is located in a residential area that is unlike many places around Amsterdam not pleasant to say the least. Upon check-in I got a room on the 11th floor without any apology or explanation of what was to come. Only after going up the elevator I discovered that the elevator only goes up to 10th floor . From there you have to walk though a hallway that smells like it is used for a toilet to a staircase that is steep and narrow up to the 11th floor - quite a challenge with my luggage ( no one had offered any help at reception...). The 11th floor room are small , even smaller than rest of hotel , with bathroom that has no room to even put down your toiletries and there a feeling of lack of breathing air throughout the floor. When I asked the next day to be moved away from this floor I was met with a lot of misunderstanding - they definitely understood why I did not want another night in that room - but no willingness to help. They were booked full - if I came back at 1300 they would look at it ( obviously could not be done as I was there for a trade-show). My colleagues who stayed with me in the same hotel did not fare much better - they weren't sent to exile on 11th floor but rooms were still small, not 100% clean , breakfast was included - but very disappointing in quality. IN summary - Stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay, but one could do better”
Reviews.Author: Radhika2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad; the rooms are small but clean. The bathroom had an odour quite unpleasant at times; when we asked the person responsible to investigate the source, we were offered an Air Freshener spray. The breakfast was simple and unspectacular. One evening we had dinner at the restaurant of the hotel, as the only guest. While acceptable, the meal was really unremarkable. The most significant drawback of the hotel is its location. Public transit is very good, but it takes about 20 minutes to get in the central area of the city. If you have a car, however, the highway is right under the hotelâ€™s windows, and one can park outside for free, provided that the car gets moved by 9 am.

Reviews.Title: “blue tower amsterdam stay”
Reviews.Author: Pick3172
Reviews.Content: Me n the missus stayed here this bank holiday. Although it was clean, thats about all we can really say in its favour. Yes you get a tv in your room, No, you can't watch it unless you pay a supplement. They say its situated in an up and coming neighbourhood, this could explain why the front entrance is locked from approx 11pm onwards. If you go out for a cigarette after that, expect a long wait to get back in. Reception is unmanned most of the night, leaving you to repeatedly ring a buzzer to gain entrance. We would in no way call this 4 star accomodation, would not recommend it and will not be using it again. Oh and you get powdered milk.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,,,still a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Lfamily83
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this best western hotel with my family for a night. We reserved the quadriple room. I thought it was a bit pricey but about the only thing I was really suprised was the actual size of the room. Its about the size of a double room from other best westerns I have stayed in; except with three beds in it. I know this is europe but it was a pretty small room for three beds and only one bath. That is the only gripe. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. Furniture seems pretty new. Theres parking right outside the hotel. It was 12 euros the night (sounds about right to me). Theres two grocery stores right next to the parking building,,,which is pretty convenient in case you need something last minute. The hotel is about 8 min drive from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was very enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Rohancummings
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews can be both helpful and off putting. The better half and myself found our stay at the Blue Tower a pleasing and comfortable experience. The location is on the outskirts of Amsterdam but as posted before the 14 tram into Dam Square is a minutes walk from the hotel and is only a 10 minute ride into Amsterdam. We found the locals to be very helpful and willing to point you in the right direction if you seemed to be a little confused or lost. There were 2 supermarkets to choose from situated beside the hotel underground car park.(this was very handy) we suggest you try to have at least one dinner at the hotel as we were both very satisfied with decor, setting, service and of course the food. The sea bass is a must. The chef even added a personal touch by cutting a piece of chicken we ordered into a heat shape, this was a nice touch as he thought the chicken was for my lady, but I had ordered it and I didn't appreciate his individuality as much as a female would've but it was a nice touch! All in all our stay was both enjoyable and comfortable, one piece of advice, the Dutch are very laid back and so much so, that we became very laid back and missed our ferry back by 2 hours due to a mixture of lasting coffee shop effects and really just taking it easy as they seem to do.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain of the year!”
Reviews.Author: gladysScotland
Reviews.Content: Booked this short break for my husband's birthday. Only cost Â£129 including flights from Liverpool and 2 nights bed and breakfast. Thanks to Trip Advisor reviewers, we found it no problem, Had been a bit concerned re some of the reviews talking about it being a dodgy area. Yes, it's a residential area but gave us no concern whatsoever. Think some folk live a sheltered life!! Reception very helpful and efficient. Room was on the 10th floor. Room was huge. Lovely bath and toiletries for soak after walking all day! Beds were really comfy. Aircondiitoning very good.Travelled in and out to Centraal and Dam Square no problem on tram and bus using 72 hour public transport pass purchased at Info centre when we got off train from airport - again all info gleaned from TA subscribers. Breakfast plentiful although husband not impressed with scrambled egg. Staff in restaurant a bit brusque but efficient. Was struggling to get wifi access on my notebook through no fault of the hotel system but then I realised there were two PCs in the reception area which were free to use. Sorted!! Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cheap but quality break within easy reach of all the many attractions of Amsterdam. Also bought a 24 hour pass on the Cnal bus which was great value too. Was surprised that we ended up eating in Greek restaurants twice - they tended to be best value although the steak on offer at one of the various Argentinian steak houses was delicious. Last point nothing to do with hotel - I was SO impressed with the Schipol Airport! Took almost as many photos there as I did of Amsterdam! of the various exhibits like the china elephants, mini Riksmuseum and Delft teapot playhouse. We'll be back to Amsterdam and hopefully the Blue Square!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Neilanddot
Reviews.Content: A good base for exploring the city with great transport links to the centre. This was our second stay at this hotel. It is not great but it is cheap and not far from all the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “OVERNIGHT STAY PRIOR TO CRUISE EMBARKMENT”
Reviews.Author: hschoen
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and were served with room accommodation right away (pre booking) and had an excellent diner service later on at the restaurant facilities. The service for the dining arrangements were outstanding and also for the next morning LATE breakfast presentation. Our thanks to all of the people that served us. Horst & Ilse Schoendube

Reviews.Title: “Reviews can be dangerous!”
Reviews.Author: Fionnuala59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Tower and enjoyed the experience, clean and plenty to eat at the breakfast buffet. 15 minutes from the centre of Amsterdam by tram and bus, great service. In a residential area never felt threatened, supermarkets just round the corner. Staff very helpful, I think it depends on expectations, if you are normal down to earth folk, you'll be fine!. We'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not too close, not too far away.”
Reviews.Author: JAYZEE79
Reviews.Content: For the price and the ten minute trip on a tram to the centre of town, this hotel is very good. It's no inconvenience to get into town. The 14 tram goes straight to Dam Square and takes ten minutes. A cab back, late at night, costs about â‚¬14-16 and is well worth the price for the mess you're probably going to be in. All in all the title says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Amsterdam..”
Reviews.Author: kellynhb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 night in June. The hotel is modern and in a fairly residential area with a main road running past. It was very quiet though and felt safe. Our 10th floor room was perfectly fine, comfortable, king bed, clean, air con, safe, tea/coffee, toiletries etc. However, we found the sheets stained with some blood after our 1st night. We complained at reception and the staff could not have been more attentive and helpful - they immediately and without question upgraded up to an executive room for free. They came with a manager to check the sheets and it was all done with great efficiency. We had only expected them to change the linen, and so we were very satisfied with the outcome situation. I believe it was a one-off incident and so I would still thoroughly recommend this hotel. Our new room was excellent, just as comfortable but larger. No complaints about the rooms at all. Breakfast was fine - streaky bacon, scrambled eggs, grilled tomatos, cold meats, cheese, rolls, croissants, fruit etc, The usual. It was self service and did the job of keeping us going through the day. Reception staff were very helpful, not only with our linen complaint but with helping us find our way around and providing information on restaurants, where to go / not go. This hotel is not in central Amsterdam - its a 10 minute tram ride. (hence why its a lot cheaper than city centre hotels). The tram is the easiest way to get around, and it stops close to hotel and is very convenient for reaching all central parts. Would recommend an Iamsterdam card (iamsterdam.com) for FREE tram / bus travel, a canal tour (excellent), free entry to museums, money off Heinken Musuem (excellent) and money off restaurants etc. Had we not had the card, we wouldnt have done as much and it worked out fanatastic value for us. It saved us loads versus buying tickets separately. Overall, this hotel is a great choice if you are travelling on a budget but want to stay somewhere decent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: r0ckst4r
Reviews.Content: The location - though on the edge of town in the suburbs - has a tram stop within a few minutes walk: this takes you into the heart of Amsterdam, without the need to change. The breakfast was fresh and plentyful, my one very minor gripe is that there could've been a little more to choose from - even if just extra cereals, or pastries - but other than that: delicious. Our room was huge - very comfortable beds, loads of room and an awesome shower. Very clean too. Everyone was friendly and helpful, all in all an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Devin509
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very expensive and provided very few amenities given the premium rate. Breakfast was not included and cost â‚¬10 per person per day. Front desk staff was not helpful. The surrounding neighborhood was inundated with litter and full of immigrants....a very bad neighborhood to be walking through (keep your hands in your pockets). Overall, this place does not live up to the standards one would expect with the Best Western name.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nosuninleeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in April, and had a great time. The room was lovely and the hotel itself very nice. We booked bed and breakfast, and the breakfast was lovely and serving times weren't too early. The staff were very friendly and helpful The only issue was the location, although this was easily overcome by the tram/bus stop 2 min walk from hotel. And the tram goes right to Dam Square (Tram 14) or the bus (I think number 22) goes straight to Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ClaireBanchory Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent at reception however in the restaurant it took us 40 minutes to get a drink after being seated despite there only being another one table in. Food was lovely. The room was nice, we were on the 10th floor, very quiet. As we were there for queen's day public transport was off so we got taxis to the centre which was fine. Normally I believe transport links are good. Overall I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellers09Germany
Reviews.Content: Location: In a multicultural suburb of Amsterdam, where many students live. There are several tram and bus connections to the center of Amsterdam. I'd recommend you buy an "OV-Chipkaart" at the Centraal Station. There are one's available for 1, 2, 3, 4, etc. days. They're really worth it and make your stay comfortable. From Central Station take bus 22 to the hotel (stop: Bos en Lommerplein). To The city center you can take Tram 12. The Station Sloterdijk is right near the hotel - take Bus 15 there. From the train station you can visit wonderful Dutch cities like Haarlem, Leiden, Den Haag, Utrecht, Gouda. The Hotel The Hotel is a 4 star hotel. The rooms are clean, comfortable. The bathrooms are modern. Breakfast is plenty. The lobby is also modern and clean. The Hotel is across the highway, but you don't really notice it. Of course the view from the room isn't that beautiful, but it didn't disturb us during our stay, as we anyways spent all day travelling around. Ask the reception for a room in a floor that you prefer (we preferred a medium high floor, so we got a room on the 4th floor). Behind the hotel is the "Bos en Lommerplein" with a market in the morning and some clothes shops. Around the corner you will find two supermarkets (one being the famous "Albert Hijn"). All in all, the stay at this hotel was excellent. *If you visit Amsterdam, don't miss the "Albert Cuyp Market" in the Oud-Zuid district. It's a trendy area and on the market you will be overwhelmed buy all the things to buy and see!

Reviews.Title: “too far out of town.”
Reviews.Author: chrisdooley14
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel,BUT thers is always a but.The hotel is to far away from the centre.Always avin to use trams to go into town,which was money we could av done without spending everyday.But i must say the trams were excellent.The hotel restaraunt menu was a limited choice,the hotel bar was a rip off.15 euros for two vodka and cokes.Not exactly city centre is it?.Then you can go in winstons bar in town and get the same two drinks for 6 euros.I wonder why the bar was always empty.Would i stay again not a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just fine, a bit far from city centre.”
Reviews.Author: HuskerKusker
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the airport do take the train into Central Station instead of Sloterdijk train station, this was way too confusing. We went to Sloterdijk train station as others on this forum suggested and tried to take a bus to the hotel. This was not easy and we were told by five different bus drivers different busses to take and routes. Took us 30 minutes to finally get the correct bus. It would have been SO much easier to take the train from the airport straight to Central Station, exit the station go across the street and purchase your day passes for the trams/busses. There was no such ticket booth available at the Sloterdijk station and we wasted money having to buy a day pass each day of our stay instead of purchasing one 48-hour pass like we could've at the Central Station. When getting off the bus or tram the hotel is just across the street, across a small square. Very easy to get too. We came back to the hotel on Saturday night about 10:30p.m. and it was a safe area. Others in our group came in very late and had no issues either. The room was very nice with a double bed and two twin beds. It was a large room with nice furniture, looked fairly new. The bathroom was nice and big with some toiletries and hair dryer provided. There was a tea/coffee service in the room. We had no issues with the room or it's cleanliness at all. The only issue was this rooms location which was next to the elevator lobby. My suggestion to the hotel would be to make the doors coming out of the elevator lobby not slam. All night/morning long I could hear that door slamming as people went to and from the elevator. Took about 20 minutes to reach Dam Square from the hotel. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so I can not comment on that. We didn't even turn on the tv so I can't comment on that either.

Reviews.Title: “The room is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_Lende Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I love the view of the room. it's really good to live in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is unsafe - My room was robbed while I was even in the room.”
Reviews.Author: getaround2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a dive of an area. Unsafe area watch your back after dark. Room was robbed the first night I was in the hotel while in bed, robber entered and picked up my unpacked bag. The robber then came back to the room 2 hours later around Midnight. Hotel was going to return my hotel room cost though never followed though. Hotel states not responsible. The door in the room has an issue with the lock, could have been an inside job as the video which is crap shown the robber go straight to elevator straight to my floor turn and go straight to my rooms and then enter and leave the room, inside to me? The streets are loud on weekends with dodgy charters as is the whole area. Simply don't take the risk, I would never have my wife or child in this hotel or in this area after dark. The local police even said to me the place is a [-]. A woman a few days earlier asked a few people for directions they turn and said how about you just give us your bag. Still waiting to the hotel to back to me about insurance.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: BlackCountryTrouble
Reviews.Content: was recomended this hotel from a friend who lives in amsterdam. she was right. nothing was too much trouble. bed and room very clean and relaxing.breakfast something for everyone. staff nice and friendly. come and go as we pleased. transport into the city is easy. shops local, and a nice local bar just down the road. will return. dont be put off by the price tariffs. shop around. we found low cost travel a lot cheaper than booking direct.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: yellotea
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant. My partner and I booked though a third party and checked in without trouble however our friends booked 3 doubles and were initially told the hotel was full and they were being sent to Blue Square sister Hotel. We kicked up a fuss and after a telephone call some rooms "become available?" Anyway, initial probs aside our room was on the top floor and three lifts meant excellent access. The views were fantastic! The room itself was exactly as advertised with classy decor, mahooooosive double bad with top quality bed linen, warm and cosy, spotless bathroom and all together a first class experience. Our friends booked breakfast beforehand and paid around 15 euros but we booked and paid 10 on arrival. Cereals, continental and cooked meant loads of choice. The location was quite a distance and we found out that booking taxi's with the hotel was much cheaper than hailing them from outside the station. Great time and would defo stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “below average”
Reviews.Author: dannystylez Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, good rooms with good heating. Breakfast selection was very good for price - overall was happy with stay but the staff could do with learning politeness. As there are many similar hotels I would not recommend this one as the others are also nice to you, which i feel is important.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: joweyDorset
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying here due to negative reviews on everything from food to location to cleanliness. We were pleasantly surprised, staff were helpful, location was ideal for public transport connections and breakfast was good. We would recommend staying here, room was clean, comfortable and cosy, beds were very good. We had no problems here whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “4 star lobby hides a 2/3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sparkydeaves
Reviews.Content: We decided to arrange a trip the first week of January to get away from what was the hustle and bustles of a busy Christmas. As most hotels were quite we decide to upgrade to a 4 star hotel as a treat. We arrived at Central Station and caught the no.21 BUS (across the bridge from the station and opposite the Victoria Hotel). The hotel is indeed about 15/20 mins out of town not a problem with the superb transport we found it quicker by tram no.14 than bus, but busses easier to find. The hotel stop is called Bos en Lommerplein. Upon arrival (after walking across the shopping plaza) we are greeted to a lavish Reception 4 star if ever I saw one. However once we reached the room we discovered thatâ€™s where the stars end! A twin room was given to us (even though a double was booked, happens a lot apparently). No mini bar standard in most 3 stars. Room covered in little (sweet wrappers, empty drink cans under bed) The cherry on the cake though, was opening the bathroom and finding the sink waste pipe on the floor and foul smelling water spewed all over the marble floor. We reported this and went out to lunch on arrival back nothing had changed so decided to fix the pipe and clean up myself. (should I send them an invoice for my plumbing??) Also to note, the hotel seems to be a favourite stay for European school/college trips. Breakfast if you can called it that!! We ate at different times of the morning and still hardly anything was available including basics like bread, juice, milk and fruit. Save yourself time and effort and eat out once you have got to town or grab some breakfast thing at the 2 supermarkets near bus stops. Now Iâ€™m sure not everyone will have these experiences but if you are thinking you are getting a four star hotel for your money you are NOT. Having lived in Amsterdam for a number of years I can say for the same price you might as well stay closer to central in a 2/3 star hotel or find a better hotel same distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Why are people complaining?? Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan103
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner from Jan 13th - 17th. Cannot fault the hotel at all really. Yeah its maybe further out than most but its modern, spacious, clean and welcoming. What more do you want from a hotel that you can get for Â£45 a night!? People who find fault with this hotel really should do there research before booking. Although im sure these are the kind of people that like to find fault. Anyway enough of my ranting! As the hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam it does require the use of public transport to get to the main tourist hotspots. (taxis to these places or the airport is really not worth the money) As Amsterdam has one of the best networks in the world this is not a problem. Tram/bus stop is literally 60 seconds up the road. You can get the number 14 or number 21. 14 takes you to Dam square, 21 to Central station. Buses and trams come literally every 5 minutes and we were never left waiting long. Dam square and Central station are only 5 min walk from each other though. A bus from the hotel to Central station takes 10-15mins. If you are going to use public transport for more than 24hours then it pays to get a bus/tram pass which can be bought in 24hour blocks. We got 72hours for about 14euro. These are bought from tourist information centre opposite Central station. To save a lot of money travelling too and from the airport go by bus and train. Get the train from Schnipol airport to Sloterdiik train station then get the number 18 bus to Bos en Lommerplein. This is where your hotel is. Its so simple, cost a quarter of the taxi fare and only took 30mins. Do the reverse to get back to the airport obviously! Only other thing to mention is the area the hotel is in. In some peoples eyes it may appear a 'rough' area but trust me its not. Its completely safe and i can only gather the negative comments are because the area is very multi-cultural. So if you have left your country mansion in the last 25 years you won't batter an eye lid! Ps. there is a free walking tour of Amsterdam that leaves the national monument in Dam square twice a day on wednesday, saturday and sunday. Well worth the small tip you end up giving the guide! Oh and the New King Mandarin restaurant in China town is one of the finest chinese meals ive ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel but a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: Amy-Chester-2012
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Amsterdam. We always stay a little away from the centre in order to get a nicer hotel for our money but we were really disappointed with the area of this hotel. The tram stop is a 1 min walk from the hotel, trams are frequent & it takes about 20mins to get to Dam Square. The hotel is randomly placed in the middle of an Asian area & surrounded by what look like lots of blocks of council flats. It is not a tourist area & there is NOTHING here for tourists except for KFC & a supermarket. This isn't ideal as it means you always have to travel in into the city for food, drinks etc which ends up in the hotel being a pain to get to and from. The hotel itself is really nice & modern & spotlessly clean, couldn't really fault the interior at all. The reception staff are very helpful if you ask them things but they don't go out of their way to be friendly, they don't seem to smile much. Breakfast wasn't geared up to the English at all, the choice was 3 cereals, a fruit bowl, various bread rolls, cheese, ham, salami, salad, scrambled egg & bacon, no pastries or bakery goods etc. They serve until 10.30am but when asking for some bacon at 9am we were told to come earlier! The staff at breakfast were rude & tables weren't being cleared. For a 4* hotel I was extremely disappointed with breakfast! We were upgraded to a large Executive room which was really nice & could not be faulted. The bed was a kingsize & super comfortable & there was lots of drawer and cupboard space. It was a little strange there being no minibar & our TV (which we didn't have to pay for) only had about 2 English channels which was a bit disappointing. If this hotel was in an area with stuff going on I would certainly stay again as I liked the hotel but in reality it's just a hotel in the middle of an Asian community council housing estate so I probably wont return and would in opt to stay in Diemen again at the NH Tropen as this is similar distance from the city but Diemen has loads going on from pubs to restaurants to shops so you don't always have to rely on being in the city. Taxi to/from airport we paid â‚¬35 & back from the city at night it's around â‚¬15. Trams to the city are â‚¬2.60 one way or â‚¬7 for a 24 hour pass.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, only 15 minutes away from city center”
Reviews.Author: Damarina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was excellent (except the scrambled eggs, which tastes like egg pudding). The rooms are very spacious with excellent beds, clean and bright. The bathrooms are nice and warm. Staff in the restaurant could have been kinder (like the staff at the reception). Comment: 1. room safe is free of charge 2. the TV is charged â‚¬ 12.5 per day 3. there is no mini-bar in the room

Reviews.Title: “Do you like bugs?!”
Reviews.Author: ms_danilova
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever been! No luggage service! No minibar! Also we had some bugs in our beds. Boorish staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in a nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GSKorelys
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Blue Tower hotel. It is a little far from the center of things -- about ten minutes by bus -- but it is a nicer hotel than you'd find closer to Dam Square for the same price. The beds were epically comfortable, the bathroom was designed a bit strangely but nice, and the staff were nothing but helpful and friendly. If you go, be sure to check out the flea market that's held every day in Lommerplein square (right around the corner). The bus stop is a two minute walk, and you can buy an unlimited 72-hour public transport pass for 15 euro per person. The only gripe I had was that the internet (free in your room) was very slow, and would kick you off and require you to log in again every 15 minutes or so. Also, an inordinate number of websites seemed to be blocked by their overzealous provider -- textsfromlastnight.com, for example, was blocked due to "adult content." We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff.......”
Reviews.Author: Mosobucks Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A little out of town but tram stop is 1 minute away and takes 15-20 pleasant mins into the city centre. You'll be unlucky to have to wait 10 minutes for one. We booked a twin room and were offered an upgrade to a triple at no extra cost - a pleasing start from our friendly receptionist. She continued by presenting us with vouchers for complimentary dinner in the restaurant that evening; we only had to pay for our drinks. This was all unexpected, yet welcome. Restaurant is Chinese themed and the open style kitchen offers you the chance to see your meal prepared to order. All the staff are happy to offer local knowledge and useful tips Location is quiet, though there are a few bars, restaurants and shops in the locale. A dual carriageway runs alongside the hotel but you can't hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Fine”
Reviews.Author: randall_one
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as there was a large convention going on in Amsterdam on that weekend and this was the closest to the city we could get. While it is about a 20 minute tram ride from the city centre, this proved to not be a problem and allowed us to see more of the city. We read some reviews that indicated that the hotel was in a dodgy part of town. The reality is that the hotel is situated within a large ethnic community and if you are not used to a multi-culural environment then it may make you uncomfortable. The rooms were fine and quite a bit larger tha I expected, noise levels were low and the staff were quite helpful in assisting us in finding our way. It was very expensive but this was a function of the IBC convention being in town. Bad timing on our part! We did not eat in the hotel restaurants so cannot comment. I would probably stay closer to the city centre, but overall I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Clean&quiet room, good breakfast, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: octavian_razvan
Reviews.Content: (+) Although we have payed for an usual ensuite room, we were given an executive one. It was a wonderful big room, with a big bathroom. The room and the bathroom had windows all along the exterior walls, making a wonderful panorama view of the sky/clouds and a luminous room. We also visited another usual rooms, as a curiosity, and except the great windows of our bathroom (and the size of room/bathroom), the rest was great too. There are quality courtains that could completely darken the rooms. The furniture inside is nice - vintage style, but is new. There was a safe locker, in the price of the room. Although near is A10 autobahn and we stayed at the 9th floor facing the autobahn, inside the room was completely quiet (there is a building and noise walls between the hotel and A10). The windows are very good phone isolators. Everithing was clean and confortable. The breakfast is until 10:30 am, a convenable hour for us, sleepy people :)). Two PCs with internet are in the lobby. Bike rental inside the lobby. 24/24h reception staff. 3 elevators. You are allowed to print 10 sheets for free. (-) PCs have no chairs, you have to stand when surfing. You can not transfer your pictures from cameras to usb memory sticks, as the pc are locked. You should be aware that if you smoke inside, there is a 100$ fine. If you are late checking out, the fine is 50$. The food is the same every day at the breakfast. The food is expensive at the restaurant. The Tv set has only pay-Tv (!?).

Reviews.Title: “Good price-quality, but staff a bit lost”
Reviews.Author: JuhS
Reviews.Content: We changed to this hotel after deciding that the 2 star hostel wasn't a good idea. Good hotel. Remember to buy those tram tickets first thing (like it's 2,5â‚¬ one hour ticket and only 7â‚¬ a whole day) because the hotel is that 10-15 min tram trip away, always. I would give it almost over three stars, but at least the staff in my case wasn't that professional. 1) They couldn't advice a proper way to the airport via the public transport so we took eventually the 40â‚¬ taxi, that hotel offered (TIP: ask from a local taxi for a offer, one taxi offered us 35â‚¬ near the hotel) 2) After the trip, noticed that my camera charger was lost int the hotel room, contacting the staff couple days after and they didn't have any clue if they had it or not.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobbyblade
Reviews.Content: have just returned from 4 night break at blue tower, room was lovely ,clean well presented but what was the concrete pillar in the room doing there, just glad i didnt walk into it during the night. breakfast very good , excellent choice but go for b&b option as it is not cheap if not prepaid, location although outside centre very accesible by tram and bus, stops just around the corner, 15 mins and your in dam square, area very built up but never felt threatened at night, also KFC next door and a nice chinese buffet place as well, would recommend this hotel and do a price check as their are some good deals about.

Reviews.Title: “Highly enjoyable trip and very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sobeney
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel, which is situated about 15 minutes by tram from the centre of Amsterdam. The tram stop is just outside the hotel and reception staff are very willing to direct and advise on attractions. I stayed with partenr and children aged 16 and 11. Accommodation was excellent. Breakfast (not included, but good value) is buffet style (eat as much as you want/ hot and cold) . We booked late, for half term and were looking for a large room to accommmodate all of us. For preference I would stay closer to the centre of Amstedam, but I must endorse other reviews which commend the standard (frequency and reliability) of public transport in Amsterdam. All in all, not a buig inconvenience to stay just outside the city.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: Tankie0
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and whilst it is not the easiest to find driving in from Germany it is well worth the traffic jams (1700 hours is not a good time to travel around Amsterdam in a car) Good fast service at check in with a room on the 8th floor that was large with great facilities. Huge soft bed and all the usual amenities. Parking next door in multistory is easy and at 12 Euros for 24 hours not bad for city, you will pay a lot more in the city centre you can also access the hotel lobby from the car park. Number 14 tram from outside KFC will take you into Dam Sq for only 2.60 and ticket lasts for one hour on any tram. Get on at the rear and pay the guy in the booth at the back, you also have to swipe your ticket on the way in and out.Get off at Westermark and Anne Franks house is right behind the church. Dam sq is about 5 minute walk from there If you don;t want to spend the money on a hotel breakfast go to the supermarket next door and buy your own, only cost about 5 euros for 6 rolls, orange and ham/cheese Way cheaper than the hotel. All in all a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Rude Receptionist Girl named Celia”
Reviews.Author: globeseller
Reviews.Content: I check in on this hotel September 23, 2010. I was traveling with my daughter. When I check in i was inform i was check in for 2 days but i was charge only for 1 day because there is no room available yet for double the next day but i am comfirm and i just need to pay the next day september 24. The next day a receptionist named celia told me to check out because she has no room for me today. I told her that I was confirm up to saturday and she said, I don't care you're out. I was shocked because never i have seen so rude demeanor and unprofessional expression from a receptionist. Apparantly, Celia her name has a lot of complaints from guest too and her boyfriend is the general manager so she can get away with her rude behavior. In short i went on the street to find another hotel. This hotel is expensive and the rooms has no outlet to charge your phones. The room is clean but the ventilation is warm and the staff are not friendly. No service at all.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service from the receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: happysockx
Reviews.Content: I was having problems connecting to the internet and the receptionist flatly said that she cannot help and there is nothing she can do. One day it was raining and I asked if I could borrow their umbrellas, they said that they need a 10Euro deposit in cash. I said I dont have cash with me only a card and suggested if they could put it in my hotel bill. They insisted on having the deposit and didnt give me the umbrella even if it were pouring. This hotel also censors websites that you visit. Dating and social websites for gay persons are blocked. Not gay friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, tidy and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Amazing376
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Tower hotel for three nights. Whilst checking in we were informed that there were no double rooms left. We found this strange as it had been booked weeks in advance. We kicked up abit of a fuss however and were given a double room in the end. The room was very spacious, definately worthy of a four star. It was clean and had a marvellous view. The hotel is about 15 mins from the centre of Amsterdam. Though it is easy accessable via tram number 14. This is just at the top of the road of the hotel, facing KFC. Taxis are typically 15 euros. Always ask how much before getting in!!!! We were charged 25 euro by one taxi driver. It can get tiresome travelling by the tram but it is also a very cheap way to get around and see all the sights. getting off at westermarkt will bring you to Anne Franks house also. All in all i think this is a great hotel and very easy to get to the centre. Dont be put of by the location reviews

Reviews.Title: “" what a great weekend"”
Reviews.Author: Bird069
Reviews.Content: 13 women stayed at this hotel on a special birthday weekend, and what a fab time had by all, this hotel was great value for the money, Martin was the first person we encountered when we arrived and he was the best, so friendly and funny he made us feel very welcome. Yes the hotel is a distance away from the centre of Amsterdam but it was no big deal jumping on a tram which by the way stopped at the top of the rd, we had a lot of fun on the tram we met some great people it was all part of the holiday. The only thing I would say is the breakfast wasn't the best but it wasn't an issue. I and I speak for all 13 of us loved this hotel and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If this is the best hotel in Amsterdam â€¦.!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GOM99
Reviews.Content: Introduction The reason for staying in this hotel - despite its location - was because of the generally good reviews it receives and the fact it has won prizes for being the best hotel in Amsterdam in recent years. Unfortunately, its halo seems to be slipping. I do not like hotels which insist on advance payment for extended stays â€“ in this case 6 nights â€“ without offering a substantial discount. I asked for an extra pillow on my way out and â€“ when it had not arrived â€“ on my way back on my second day â€“ it did not come. After a third â€“ written â€“ request I finally got it the next day. The floor was not vacuumed for at least three days in a row and we were left with a toilet roll with only a few sheets and no spare. Increases in public transport fares mean that, certainly if you are a couple, you can easily afford to pay â‚¬20 a night more for a central location and still show a profit. This is what I will do next time. It is â‚¬2.60 for a single ticket on the tram or bus for one hour â€“ though only â‚¬7 all day which is quite good value â€“ although on two out of five occasions the tram conductors did not have the tickets. As this was only 10am it smacks of poor planning on the part of the individual conductor or the company. It also gives you a chance to see multi-cultural Amsterdam as you travel on the buses and trams or, looked at another way, travel with dangerous looking youths and kids who run riot and scream for the whole journey. The hotel is certainly situated in a â€œmulti-culturalâ€� area. This does mean plenty of â€œethnicâ€� food in the restaurants and shops. There are two good supermarkets immediately behind the hotel â€“ under the market square â€“ plus a KFC, banks, etc. Room Apart from a large pillar in the middle of the room it was of reasonable size with a decent size bathroom and shower. If you shut the bathroom door it required a lot of force to open it once more. There was a large, comfortable â€“ if anything too soft â€“ bed with slightly small sheets. The (central) air conditioning coped with the July temperatures. The room has a kettle, safe, flat screen TV (with BBC 1 and 2) but no â€˜fridge which, given the heat and the fact the hotel says it is 4*, would have been nice. There was free wireless internet but not of very high speed. The view â€“ of a block of council flats at close range - was uninspiring! I had requested a â€œhighâ€� room but was put on the 4th floor out of 10! - another example of the hotel not paying attention to detail. Noise If anyone slammed a door anywhere on the floor my door and lampshade rattled loudly. Unlike some other hotels, there is only one door to the corridor and not an â€œair-lockâ€� formed by a second inner door to deaden the noise. If you are prone to singing in your shower be warned that, thanks to the ventilation system, your â€œconcertâ€� will be broadcast around the hotel â€“ as will your neighbours for you to hear. Food As breakfast was not included in the rate we used the excellent supermarket next door for pastries etc. Breakfast was available at â‚¬10 if ordered the night before or â‚¬14.50 if you just turn up. From the noise emanating from the breakfast room when the lift stopped there on the way out in the morning â€“ something like school dinners at a primary school with a poor disciplinary record â€“ I am glad we opted for the â€œself-serviceâ€� option! The hotel does have a restaurant and there are others nearby â€“ one of which does a full English breakfast. Amsterdam Amsterdam should be a delightful place to stroll along the canals and stop in a shady bar for a beer or jonge jenever. However, of course the actuality is somewhat different as you try to avoid being mown down by kamikaze cyclists and motor cyclists who obey no rules of the road and who park their machines all over what little pavement there is by the canals. However, with a little effort it is possible to enjoy walking by the more distant canals. The Hortus (botanical gardens) is well worth a visit for somewhere peaceful for a change. If you are not too prudish and like a good laugh then the Sex Museum is for you. The main museums are overcrowded and overpriced but there are plenty of smaller ones - like the purse and bag museum â€“ to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliG317
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel on a quick 2 night stay with friends to Amsterdam. Immaculate hotel with everything you could possibly need. Staff very helpful. It is probably about 10/15misn tram ride from Dam Square (main area of Amsterdam) but trams very frequent - staff point you in right direction and you see more whilst sitting aboard. Great hotel would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, bad location”
Reviews.Author: businessCanada
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying here after reading some bad reviews, but it turned out to be a great stay. I'm sure we had one of the worst rooms in the hotel - next to the dining room, service room and near the elevators and stairwells, but it was relatively quiet and we're very light sleepers. The bathroom is large and almost North American like which is quite something for Europe. The beds were comfortable and the room was large. It's fairly basic, but we had no complaints. It was clean and the bathroom sparkled. A young man cleaned it while we were having breakfast and he did a thorough job at top speed. The breakfast was amazing. There were hot and cold items, lots of fruit, breads, eggs, cereal and if you couldn't find something you liked, you must be a picky eater. Some times it was just a matter of waiting a few minutes until they brought out a new supply but they were obviously trying to cater to British and North American customers. Checking in and out was a matter of seconds. Staff had excellent English and were very friendly and helpful. There are two computers in the lobby for your use and they were pretty quick. The location is a concern. I was with my husband but this is not an area where I would stay if I were with another woman. A young lady I know who lives in the area has been accosted several times by men. The market outside the hotel is full of cheap quality goods. Save your time and bypass it and the stores, although the grocery stores are okay. there's a banking machine on the other side of the hotel. Buses and trams into the city are a 2 minute walk from the hotel and we had no difficulty, although I'm not sure we would have ever found our way to the hotel from the airport on our own. take a GPS with you. We were met by friends and the combination of trains and buses was confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star level”
Reviews.Author: mudoje
Reviews.Content: I am not into this hotel classification but certainly it isn't as equal as it should be in whole Europe. I get much better hotel in 3 star in Bucharest than this 4 star in Amsterdam and I will remind that Romania is generaly poor country. About the same was experience with Czech. First of all, eventhough it is cold for this time of the year, the two windows only open longitudinaly for a bit and it is impossible to open entire window so it was relatively hot in the room while air-con wasn't working even after few complains. Looking at extremely ugly Muslims in neighbourhood isn't the problem, someone said people who don't like this are islamophobs which isn't true for me or other people who hate this place, I'm sure, cause problem is hotel itself. Next, there was a strange quite knocking from inside the walls, I believe it is something about instalation and it iritates. Adjusting the water in the shower is horrible and impossible job because if you move it just a bit it either freezes you or burns. TV wasn't working properly, it turned off by itself after turning on if you don't press some button which I accidentaly discovered. Nevermind the fact that Philips was LCD with horrible picture quality and bugged by deformed stretched picture. Trip to Brussels that was offered by hotel was horribly organized in its start because taxi drove was in city centre to the agency 1 HOUR before take off time instead just telling us to come to that adress in proper time or to drive us in proper time. On the good side, net nearby reception was ok, but only 2 computers for big hotel. Hotel is on 15 mins from city centre or Ledseplein. And on check out they wanted to charge us pay tv????Free tv worked barely and they wanted us to pay pay tv which we never used. In the end they gave up that after we explained but that's good proove how patheticaly unorganized they are and how EVERYTHING buggs in there. And conclusion, if you don't have the problem that it is more like low end 3 star hotel rather than 4 star and you pay for it 70 euros per day then go for it but I thin IT ISN'T WORTH THW MONEY

Reviews.Title: “great place 2 stay”
Reviews.Author: nedcar
Reviews.Content: have just came back from staying here had a great time wiyh my wife n 18 month old daughter stayed on 8th floor excelent views my daughter loved them the most ... iv read some of the other poeples reviews about the ares it was in not being nice i think these people are islamaphobes we went to the local shops and markets in the area and the people could not have been nicer and the prices were second 2 none we would have payed trebbel if not more in city center ...this hotel is only fifteen minutes by tram from city center the number 14 takes u rite 2 dam sguare and at only 2 euro 60 cent u cant complain we will certinly be using this hotel again and would recomend it 2 any one the only thing i didnt like was some of the suits that were staying there pushing in in front of you and looking down at you but if you just thing like me and say well they are just as skint as me as theye r staying way out here as well and they are no way better than me or you infact they are the ones who need 2 have a good look at there self in mirror but in fa scotland so i dont give a toss .....so if you can put up wi them this is the best hotel and location i have stayed in and iv been 2 the dam a lot of times olso you are only a fifteen minute walf away from rembrant park so go to this hotel and enjoy yourself

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities but a bit far from the amsterdam town centre!!”
Reviews.Author: anandrajdesai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at his hotel when I went to visit a friend who was working in Amsterdam last year. The price of the hotel was within my budget and I thought it was very close to the amsterdam city centre so I booked it for three nights. The services provided within the hotel were fantastic in terms of room service, amenities etc. Even the size of the room was larger than I expected making you feel quite relaxed and not crammed up in a tiny place. However, the only disappointing thing was that it was in the outskirts of the amsterdam city centre and it took me 30 mins everyday to go to the city which was kind of a problem if you wanted to go back to the hotel and relax frequently. If you are looking at affordable accommodation and dont mind travelling 20-30 mins to city centre then this hotel is something i would recommend to you. The taxi fares from hotel to the city were around 10 europs whereas a tram ride was no more than 2-3 euros which was worth it considering the fact that room prices for other hotels in the city centre were around 30-40% more. Not fantastic but worth a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfertable”
Reviews.Author: MissPicks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is opposite a tram line that takes you to and from the centre of Amsterdam to Dam Square. Although this is a great location away from the hustle and bustle this is also a difficult to find hotel if you are not aware as to where it is located. the tram is the number 14 from Dam Sqaure. The hotel is very comfertable and very spacious and we did very much enjoy our stay here. The staff are fantastic and very helpful. The hotel does offer free internet access. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bit out the way from Amsterdam Centre..but hey you should experience public transport..its worth it”
Reviews.Author: LovetheWorld2010
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked this hotel through the BA website....we were a bit concerned about some reviews regarding distance from the actual amsterdam city centre, but our good experience of Best Western Hotels were good, so we booked regardless and city centre hotels had shot up in price anyways. The hotel website has great instructions on which tram and bus to catch to and from Amsterdam City Centre. The location of the hotel is good, the locals were friendly and going about their daily lives. In the day its buzzing with workers and local shoppers and on certain days there was a market square with lots of bargains. There is also restaurants take- aways, KFC (although UK one is the best :D) and supermarkets. The room we booked was just a double room nice furniture, flat screen telly, nice tiled clean bathroom, it was a funny shape room but it was nice and cosy. The breakfast room was amazing lovely range of teas, juices, fruit, only downside was they didn;t have any sausages, but lots of nice bacon and boiled and scrambled egg. Nice decor to enjoy your brekkie in, amazing artwork on walls and lovely views and stylish furniture. Back to our room there was some cobwebs on the ceiling, I did ask nice lady at reception if it could be cleaned she said it should be sorted by the time we came back from our day out. When we came back It wasn't cleaned I just assumed they never got round it to it.....when we went to reception to upgrade our telly service, the nice lady at reception asked if our cobweb problem was sorted, I said no it was still on the ceiling...she offered us a free complimentary drink in the bar which I thought was nice, her manager then whispered something in her ear and the reception asked us if we would like a free room upgrade instead, we were like yes please.!.... The room upgrade was well worth it, it was in the top floor with beautiful view of the city streets nice spacious room, only downside no mini bar to keep our drinks cool :), the bathroom was amazing while on loo or in shower there were beautiful views of the city streets very nice room.....I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad about the surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Billunga
Reviews.Content: Online reviews were very accurate so we were quite prepared for what we got in terms of amenities, location and transport. The hotel could do a better job of maintaining the front entrance. The dirty carpet leading up to the front entrance gives a poor first impression. The staff were alert but not welcoming. The room was spacious but looked out onto a 1st floor terrace which was not clean. The lighting was very poor in the room and it was always gloomy inside. The cups were chipped and when we pointed it out to the housekeeping staff they advised us that they did not have any more cups in stock. Breakfast was good and the staff were attentive. There is a small supermarket as well as a bakery opposite, a short distance up the road however the highlight would have been the seafood shop Canarische Viswinkel which is at no.76. Though no one spoke any English we were able to communicate with the owner in French and had a wonderful seafood platter and soup. It is wonderful to find friendly and hospitable people on your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: kesibmik
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is a bit out there (20 min. by bus to Central Station, 10-15 min. by tram to the main attractions) but for the price you pay it makes it ok. It is located next to a market and there is a grocery store next door with very cheap eats. The hotel had more space then you would generally find in most hotels but the floor looked ragged and don't look under the beds. The bathroom was clean and the beds were amazingly comfortable. We didn't spend much time there but that was ok. It is very easy to get to all the attractions with two tram stops outside of the hotel (about a block away). The hotel is not in a very tourist part of town which I see as a benefit (live like the locals) Very easy to get to Schipol Airport by way of the Metro and the Leylann train station.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for money hotel with excellent transport links to the whole city.”
Reviews.Author: Helpmeimlost
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located outside the city centre but it is less than 200 metres away from tram and bus stops from which you can get to all parts of the city.The trams and buses run every 10 minutes during the week and every 15 minutes on Sundays.The journey time to Dam Square is less than 15 minutes. Just make sure to purchase a travel card for the length of your stay - this makes individual journeys quite inexpensive. The hotel is easy to get to from the station or airport .It is modern and bright with a small business centre with free access to internet facilities. It is adjacent to a small shopping precinct which includes a small market each day. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful with an excellent command of English. We had one problem with a defective safe and this was rectified on the same day as it was reported. The cost of our stay for a long weekend included bed and breakfast. Breakfast was available for three and half hours from 7am. and comprised a hot and cold buffet with a good selection of different dishes including fresh fruit and fruit juice - the only two small criticisms being that the grapefruit and oranges were of the tinned variety and that the single coffee/tea making machine could cause queues to build up.The dining room and bar staff were always friendly, efficient and effective. The hotel seemed to offer a good menu for an evening meal but there were so many restaurants a short tram ride away that we never actually dined at the hotel itself The rooms were large, clean and comfortable with quiet and effective air-conditioning The bathroom/ toilet was also large and kept clean and properly stocked throughout our stay.The rooms were easy to get to directly from the reception area via 3 different lifts. The best thing about this hotel was that although it was not within walking distance of the city centre it had excellent transport links and it offered excellent value for money.. The biggest problem was that the size and location of the hotel meant that is was clearly attractive to coach tour holiday groups so if two such groups were committed to having breakfast at the same time the restaurant, its buffet breakfast, and its staff could be a bit overwhelmed - however the staff always seemed able to get everything back on track within 20-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not as safe as I thought it was going to be.”
Reviews.Author: hockeyfamily6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a less than desirable neighorhood but we felt a little safer because we knew our van was going to be locked in a secured parking structure with no one being able to go in or out after 10:00pm. HA ! When we went downstairs the next morning, our van had been broken into! Luckily, we had taken everything upstairs with us, so they got NOTHING. However, our van was not the only one targeted-other vehicles with German license plates were also broken into. We were even parked about 50 meters from the door that leads to the hotel lobby-and NO ONE heard our car alarm or no one elses??? That is really sad. On the upside, the staff were helpful and nice before and after the break-in but I would not recommend staying at this hotel! There are other hotels closer to everything and in a better area!

Reviews.Title: “Nice price for an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: vincent1568
Reviews.Content: Our room was very noisy at 10th floor, view on the highway, be sure to ask a room on the other side or you might need earplugs to sleep.
