Receptionist was just OK but I had to ask many questions (about transports, parking, breakfast, etc.). There is a parking in a garage for a good price and they give you 2 free tickets to downtown. Trip is 15 minutes. We didn't take the breakfast which is very expensive. The main interest is the price and the parking. WIFi is also free.

Reviews.Title: “OK But a Bit Far Out”
Reviews.Author: portorl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quiet and clean. Rooms were very large for Europe - felt like I was staying in an American hotel. We had two single beds and there was plenty of room to walk around. Location was a drawback - 15 minute bus ride from the Central Station. Neighborhood was okay, however I would not have wanted to venture too far away from the hotel. Two grocery stores located in the same building as the hotel - huge plus. Front desk help was spotty. they failed to call us with our wake up call causing us to miss our morning train - so bring your own clock don't depend on them.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but definitely not perfect”
Reviews.Author: brennand1
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us, booking a quad deluxe room arrived on a Saturday morning from Schipol Airport, staying for six days. We all had struggled to travel to the hotel as public transport was pretty hard to understand - this was only to be expected. We we're told we couldn't check-in until 14.00 on the first day, but a couple of hours after that we we're told we couldn't, as they had overbooked! We were moved to their sister hotel - the Blue Square, about 1-2 miles down the road. The rooms were very similar, but what annoyed me more than most is that both hotels had stupid rivalries and brinkmanship between the two, saying "ours is best" all the time. The second day we we're told we could we could move back which we did. The room wasn't perfect by any means. There were black marks on the curtains and rings on the windowsill which I assume had beer cans on. However, both the bathroom and the beds themselves were clean which is the main thing. We didn't spend much time in the hotel room, so it was good for what we needed. There was a decent view of West Amsterdam from our 8th floor room. Eventhough there was a motorway very close, sleeping was fine and the hotel was quiet. Prices in the city for food and drink especially is extortionate to say the least. I once paid 6.50 one night just for a Coke and one of the shops just outside the hotel we're selling oranges for 2Euro... per orange! We didn't eat in the hotel having found out that a buffet breakfast cost 14.50 a time. We managed to work out in the end the confusing public transport system. It works well if you know what you're doing! I advise getting a 3 day chipcard for 15Euro a piece, but you can get different durations for your needs. You can have unlimited access to trams, buses and metro trains. Well worth it and better than spending 2.60 for a single ticket! The hotel is some distance from the city centre, but is very easy to get to. Tram 14 goes directly to Dam Square. Customer service was OK, despite the fact the staff struggled to speak much English. They helped out as much as they could.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Grainneam
Reviews.Content: This is most definitely not the quality or service I expect when I book a BW hotel. This is also definitely not a 4-star hotel. Let me enumerate the deficiencies: No iron or ironing board available all day - & if it were available, I would have to come to the lobby & carry an iron & ironing board to the 10th floor myself; foul smelling hallways; dirty & shabby room furniture; battered & chipped walls - no wall without spills dripping down it; trash on the floor in the lobby & hallways; elevators that open to sight of piles of dirty laundry; unsecure login for wireless internet which requires re-logging in every time I reopen IE; television that doesn't work properly & a maintenance man who says there is nothing he can do; a safe missing a vital piece; an ice request met by an allowance of 1 glass from the restaurant; stained bed covers; staff who fail to acknowledge your presence at reception; only one person available to check people in at 2 PM - prime check in time; misinformation about parking costs.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has gone down in my estimations”
Reviews.Author: SnowWhite78
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Blue Tower. We stay here as we have family nearby, not for the Amsterdam attractions (the centre is 15 minutes by tram). On arrival we were allocated a room on the first floor. This floor is shabby. It's right by the restaurant and the rooms appear to be for staff. The hallway is shabby and rooms have numbers printed on paper and stuck to the doors. We had a strange shaped room, long corridor, small bathroom with only a shower and a double bed crammed into a corner room with windows on two sides. The windows looked out on the flat roof at the front and side of the hotel were there were broken chairs and rubbish. The room was cold despite upping the temperature. There was a persistent sound of running water so after one night we asked to move. Reception staff did find us another room but I was disappointed that our complaint did not seem to come as a surprise. There was not apology either. So room number two on the 8th floor was fine. Although in neither room did we have a tea bags or milk for a drink and neither was particularly clean. However, it was quiet and we did sleep well. Unlike our companions who had a 9th floor room on the A10 ring road side and really suffered with the traffic noise. So, on to the reasons why this hotel has gone down in my estimationsâ€¦ 1. The situation with the lifts. There are three but you have to wait forever for one to arrive. It is ridiculous for a hotel with 10 floors. The stairs are not obvious although we did find them. The cleaners use the stairwell to smoke and they are smelly and dirty. I was really concerned to find that on the ground floor the stairwell, which is an emergency exit was blocked! 2. The staff are not rude but there is no real customer service. No one really cares. I suppose this is the reality in a big hotel but it could be improved, drastically. 3. Breakfast. 14.50 Euros for not a lot. Really expensive, I would recommend getting something from the supermarket or bakery across the street. 4. Cleanliness of both public areas and rooms could be better. Generally dusty and dirty. Good things to note - the adjacent car park is cheap if you decide to take your car. 6 Euros a day but you must get a tram ticket there and speak to the attendant. There is a connecting door to the hotel although the two businesses are separate. I will look for alternatives before automatically choosing the Blue Tower the next time we go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cant really fault”
Reviews.Author: brum82
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room on BB basis at the hotel for 3 nights! Cant fault really, I knew the hotel was out of the centre but it was easy enough to travel into centre. Buses to Central Station or Trams to Dam Sq or Leidensplein area right outside hotel. You can get a card which is 7.60euro which gives you travel upto 14 times depending on how far you go on tram, if travelling into centre its 3 zones tho so 3 spaces are stamped. B/fast in hotel was ok, nothing special, cerals, yogurts, breads, cheese, meats and 4 items of hot food. as well as juices and tea and coffee. Rooms were nice - we had 4 single beds in our room which was what we needed and still had alot of space. If staying for one or two nights would def stay here again, if more than this maybe not as travelling takes up 10/15 mins and adds up over days. Hotel had free wi-fi throughout - but had to keep signing in every 5 mins which was a bit of a pain. KFC, a couple of supermarkets are all on hand outside the hotel for any essentials you need. Taxi from centre of town is no more than 15 Euro - dont be ripped off especially of night time, but as i said buses and trams are great too!! In the Leidensplein area there is a great sports bar that does 11.99 eat as much as can Ribs!! def recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value Hotel with good service and very friendly/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Blobber Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay with excellent transport interconnects to our meeting venue and into central Amsterdam. We arrived on a very wet and cold evening following a hard day at a convention, the welcome at the Hotel was warm enought to thaw us out and make us feel very welcome. The reception staff were very helpful and unprompted gave us lots of information about trams, busses and restaurants so that we could get on with our evening as soon as we were ready. We had a 'meeting' drink in the Hotel bar, the Barman was most helpful without being crowding, the beers came with an unending supply of 'nibbles' which were most welcome after a hard day. The restaurant lookd good but was not at all busy probably due to the time of year, there was a 25% reduction promotion in the restaurant at the time of our stay. I would recommend this hotel as a budget option for those who don't mind staying 20 minutes out of central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel with VERY over priced Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: USAlivinginEurope
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam with my husband and another couple and I must say that it was a good value for the money for 4 people. We parked in the Q-park next door for 26 hours and it was 14 Euro, which is much less than driving to the city center. A taxi from the hotel to the city center varied from 15-20 euro plus tip, so we ended up spending quite a bit on transportation. The room itself was well appointed and we had no problems outside of the sink in the bathroom stopping up. Reception was very friendly and helpful upon arrival, however, I think the hotel would be better reviewed if the 1st floor bar was more friendly and open past 10pm! We did not feel welcome at all when we arrived at the bar at 9:45. The breakfast is grossly overpriced. It's 14.50 Euro/person and very sparse. We went downtown later that day and found several places that had full English breakfast for 7 Euro (and we are American). In general, not a bad hotel, but expect to pay for parking/transportation. Amsterdam is an expensive city!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: amk08
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to find this hotel amongst the many to choose from in amsterdam. The hotel was a perfect choice in retrospect. Great value for money and the locatoin was convenient just 15min from the centre of amsterdam. it was nice to have that bit of distance to explore other parts of the city. The hotel staff were very accomodating. Allowed us to use the large screen desktop computer. The room had 3 single beds which we required. The bathroom was large and clean...even had underfloor heating. The breakfast was hearty and filling with lots of variety of cold and hot choices. The general manager, Martin was very accommodating to give information on local things...he will remember me as the girl who asked alot of questions:) All in all a great place to stay and explore amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I'have ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: GoodOne34
Reviews.Content: Excellent great breakfast room was fantastic with all funitures! a five star hotel at the price of a three!

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable in every way”
Reviews.Author: FranTravel
Reviews.Content: I sleepily stumbled through the automatic doors of the Blue Tower Best Western hotel, Amsterdam, Holland. Behind me dragged my luggage, my boyfriend and numerous plastic bags filled with accumulated treasures from our previous stop in Rotterdam. The only thing that had got any lighter that day was my purse. We had parked in the underground car park next to the hotel. It has a direct entrance into the hotel reception, however the parking isnâ€™t free for hotel guests. The entrance area is certainly no big talking point, clean but rather unwelcomingly lit and furnished. It was cold and gave the impression of an office block reception rather than a hotel. A small and unfrequented bar sits to the right. After having completed the usual check-in formalities, we headed up to our room on the 7th floor. Iâ€™d like to say that the lifts in that hotel are the slowest in the world, but that would be unfair, I havenâ€™t tried them all. My boyfriend and I stayed in room 710 and despite having booked a double room, were disappointed upon entrance to see two twin beds pushed together, yet made up individually. It made no sense. Surely even if one person had booked the double room, it would be sensible to assume that the reason they had done so was that they wanted a double bed. My mistake perhaps. Despite this, the room was of acceptable size with a large window that overlooked the city. It was nicely furnished, if not a little dated, with mahogany wardrobes, cabinets and two chairs by the window. It had the usual amenities: tea-making facilities, TV, air-con/heating, safe and hair dryer but no mini bar. An added bonus was the free Wi-Fi Internet access in the room, which nowadays is essential, particularly for customers who are traveling for business. The telephone didnâ€™t work, although, from overhearing another customerâ€™s complaint at reception, it would seem that this was the case throughout the building.Â  The bathroom was clean and stocked up with the basics. It had a bath and integrated shower that worked perfectly and was very much appreciated throughout our stay. After an ok night's sleep, the following morning I decided to visit Amsterdam city centre. One of the staff at reception called me a taxi and I waited in the lobby for my allocated 10 minutes for it to arrive. The cab was to cost 15 euros, fixed rate, to the square. Reasonable. As I mused over this thought, aggressive shouts echoed through the room, bringing me back to reality like a slap round the ears. One of the staff members was arguing fiercely over the phone. She was sat behind an opaque glass screen acting as a small office next to the reception. I wondered whether she thought it was soundproof as she yelled expletives at a certain â€œChrisâ€�.Â  I couldnâ€™t believe what I was hearing and was amazed at the level of unprofessionalism that I was witnessing. Already, up until that point, I hadnâ€™t found the staff to be particularly friendly but this was just unacceptable, not to mention uncomfortable. The taxi arriving was a relief to say the least. We stayed for two nights and on the second decided to sample the food at the hotel restaurant on the 1st floor. This in itself was a task as it wasnâ€™t clear where it was and in the end we had to ask at reception. The restaurant is new and only opened in July this year. Compared to the rest of the hotel, it is rather luxurious. It has the appearance of a fancy gastro pub, dimly lit and furnished in a modern â€œleather chairs and wooden tablesâ€� kind of way. Our time there however, was very short lived. After sitting down and browsing over the menu, it quickly became clear that the price-list was way out of our league with a main dish averaging at 20 euros and a bottle of still water at 6. It seemed so strange that a pretty averagely priced hotel would have such an expensive restaurant, particularly as this is the only one in the place. We left in the hope of finding somewhere a little more down to earth in the city. The Blue Towerâ€™s location is too far from the centre to walk and there isnâ€™t anything of any interest close by. Which, in itself is pretty inconvenient when there is only one over-priced restaurant in the hotel and nothing to do in terms of evening entertainment. Â Overall, I wouldnâ€™t recommend it to anybody wanting to visit Amsterdam and would think twice before staying there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Agreed with previous reviewers”
Reviews.Author: SuppersReady
Reviews.Content: It's diffcult to disagree with much that has already been written about the Blue Tower. It's a very nice hotel and good value because of it's out of centre location. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade and our room was lovely with a very large bathroom. The breakfast didn't provide too many choices but all was very good quality. The reception staff were all very friendly and happy to answer our many questions. The hotel is located behind the shopping precinct at Bos en Lommerplein. The area has many shops and several supermarkets and felt perfectly safe to walk around. To get to the hotel from Centraal station take either the 18 or 21 bus to Bos en Lommerplein (the next stop is displayed on all buses and trams so don't worry that you won't know where to get off). You can also take the 14 tram to Dam Square, the Anne Frank museum and Rembrantsplein and the 7 tram to Leidseplein. All journeys take 15 to 20 minutes which isn't too bad but did get a bit tiresome after a couple of days. It's worth buying the public transport day passes from the information office outside Centraal (they are sold for durations of 1 to 4 days) as this will probably save you money if you make a couple of trips into town a day. A couple of general observations. For restaurants, it's worth going to Leidseplein in the evening as the competition means that there is better value to be had than in other areas in the centre - several Italian restaurants are offering decent quality pizza and pasta menus for 5 euros. Due to the low Sterling rate we found much in Amsterdam quite expensive so such cheap meals in reasonable restaurants was a good find. I'd also recommend the "La Place" food hall in the V&D department store on Damrak for very good value food. One thing that caught us out was the ticket machines in Centraal and Schiphol. Tickets are 50 cents cheaper if you buy from the machines, rather than from the ticket office. Not all machines take cash and those that do only take coins - no notes. Also the lockers for left luggage only take payment by credit or debit card.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Westvig
Reviews.Content: So we stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and got there a bit late the first night. We were too tired after our journey to notice some of the quite horrific things about our room the first night, and we were too polite to complain the next day. Out bathroom had a broken downlight hanging by its wires down from the lightbox, and they had tried to fix it with regular blank tape. Our faucet was leaking badly and ruined everything around it. The tiles had old screwholes gone all yellow and the places where the tiles were cut to fit the sockets there were huge gaps. The airconditioning hadn't been cleaned for ages. The main lamp in our room had seen better days and our curtains had some strange black stuff/dirt/gunk on them that didn't seem all that sanitary. Naturally we didn't spend that much time in our room, and the hotels bikerental, breakfast and information available was all great. We do wish we had chosen a hotel closer to town, but as our journey was arranged by others we made the best out of it. We do recommend renting bikes and getting around that way.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kinothai
Reviews.Content: This modern 4 stars Hotel is a little bit far away from the city centre but with easy access to with several pubblic transport lines running 24 hrs. The front desk staff is one of the most helpful and professional ever met. Good size and well equipped bedroom. Various and good quality breakfast buffet. Highly recommended accommodation while in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shakeishah25
Reviews.Content: This hoyel was great, had great service, would highly recommend it. The food was even great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but there is room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: rakushka
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Amsterdam after staying for 8 nights at the Blue Tower Best Western hotel. Overall, I would say that it's a very nice hotel, new, nice facilities, clean rooms, etc. We were looking for a hotel that is not in the center, but is in a more quiet neighborhood, since we were travelling with our 6 year old daughter. We did have to book a triple room since European hotels often have just twin size beds, and we had 3 people. The hotel is located in the Bos en Lommerweg neighborhood, and the tram stop is right next to the hotel, so it's an easy 15 minute ride to the center, which we didn't mind at all. I did not like the breakfast at the hotel that much, but we usually didn't take advantage of it as we woke up too late. A "Bagels and Beans" cafe right across the street on Bos en Lommer will cost you about the same or less, and the food's better. Now, for the annoying parts: the free Wi-Fi, which was one of the important features of this hotel for us, didn't work for 6 out of the 8 days that we stayed there. I honestly don't know what takes so long to fix it. That was a major inconvinience, as we were planning to rely on finding out various details of our trip on the internet, and were not able to do so (that same Bagels and Beans cafe does have a free Wi-Fi that works). Also, my pajamas disappeared one of the days after they cleaned the room. I doubt anyone took it on purpose, probably the cleaning people grabbed it by mistake, but they never did find it, which was also a bit annoying. Other than that, I thought it was a nice place to stay in Amsterdam. If you have a car, there is a garage right next to the hotel where you can park your car, which is not cheap (14 euroes a day), but it is open only until 10 p.m. If you come after 10 p.m., you can leave your car on the street, but you will need to either move it to the garage or pay for parking starting at 9 a.m. the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, poor service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: BiggerBlings
Reviews.Content: Booked online, had never been to this hotel and certainly wouldn't go again. Rooms are comfy, decent bathrooms, but the service lets it down big time. The bar is only open from 5.30pm until 10pm, so if you're coming back from a night out you won't be able to sit in the bar for a nightcap. This was a major flaw as far as we were concerned. There were free travel cards available from the car park next door, where you park if you have driven, but we had to ask in the car park after paying top prices on the trams, the reception staff didn't tell us anything at all. But using the trams was very easy. To finish it all, the free wireless stopped working as well.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't of asked for a better stay”
Reviews.Author: sienade
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband satyed here for a short honey moon. i had a very very nice stay and will be back again. bad points. its a little out of the city. and when we went to find travel help i was a little worried as they said its quite far out . well after discovering that you can infact get a tram and a bus there there is was no worrying needed. i travell further to wok every day. it only takes 15 mins on the bus(bus 21 from central station) or 10 mins on the tram(14 dam square). each time i went to the stop iaited no more then 3 mins for transport. wich is far better then the service in england. the stop is a bout a 2min (at a push) walk away from the hotel. you cant smoke inside the hotel. well if you didn't no this there is a smoking ban in holland now just like england so get used to it. there very strict and will charge you Â£100 if caught. for 'young' smokers there is a bit of a wall you can smoke outside if thats what your in Dam to do. Good points. Well on arrival We were upgraded to a HUGE corner room. which gave us great panoramic views of the city. its was a very very nice room. huge king size bed, massive flat screen T.V (ONLY BBC WORLD NEWS IN ENGLISH THOUGH) loads of closets space. and just a massive room. (707) fresh towels every day, very very clean bathroom and such a warm reception from the staff who were always egar to please. we didn't need to but we also could have it cleaned every day to. i did not have a laptop so can't comment on the connection but there was free internet access in recception. Again can't comment on the reasturant but whenever we went past it was busy and smelt amazing. we were offered our 1st free drink there but the prices were a litlle high Â£25-Â£45 a head. We would recommend using the two very cheap supermarkets which are just round the cornner. in fact there actually part of the building of the hotel you just need to walk round. there is also a bakery 1 min walk to the left and a market on a few days a week here you can get fresh fruit. I would not recommend this hotel to any body who is just going to Dam to get so wrecked out their face they need to crawl home. but if youur willing to do a little (and it really is a little) travelling into dam (in fact i stayed at ehe eden hotel last time and from Dam square its a good 20-25 min walk) then you will be fine. just take in the scenery as you drive past and you will be ther in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be faulted.”
Reviews.Author: seanppk
Reviews.Content: Try as I might I can't find fault with this hotel. My other half and I stayed for 3 nights whilst visiting relatives who live locally. We'd driven across from the UK, so were glad that the hotel was so easy to find once leaving the A10 ring road. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly, the service was more than adequate and information was provided by reception to help anyone whether they're new the city or an old hand. There is a secure car park which can be accessed from the hotel lobby. This isn't affiliated with the hotel, so is charged separately, but you can get a discount if you use the car park as a park and ride, and get tram tickets from the car park office. We sorted our transport out separately (foolishly), so the parking was 12 Euro per day. For us it was ideal, as it was 2 minutes from where we wanted to be, on a main tram route into the centre of town, with a cool, clean room and comfortable beds. There are a number of shops and supermarkets nearby (and an awesome Turkish bakery), so everything within easy reach. Value was exceptional also (booked through lastminute.com), so very pleased all round. Didn't eat in their restaurant, but the menu sounded great with a very Asian theme. Will give it a try next time as we'll be sure to stay there again for the next outing.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: We were accommodated in this hotel by the receptionist of the other hotel of the same chain, because there were bedbugs in the hotel we spent our first night in Amsterdam. The room we had was a corner-room on the 9th floor, quite large with two whole wall windows, which offered very nice view of the city. The breakfast was included and was correct though there werenâ€™t a lot of dishes to choose. There were several tram and bus stops next to the hotel, two supermarket and a couple of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: trunorth1000
Reviews.Content: Location is well outside centre but we didn't have a problem travelling in by tram - very convenient. Note if you have a car you don't want to drive into the centre as parking is astronomical in cost. Expensive parking but they had a deal where parking was 50% of cost when used public transportation (and they supplied the tickets). Service at desk was very good. Breakfast too expensive. Room was average - we had a pole in centre of room, the drains were extremely slow and they couldn't correct the problem. Looks like rooms are starting to get run down. Not much around hotel at all. Availability of free internet highly valued.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to explore from”
Reviews.Author: Disburg
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It was nothing fancy, but the place was fine, it was very quiet, and there were several buses and trams that stopped out front. An added bonus was that there were several good bakeries within a block of the front door, and there was a great place for ery cheap Turkish pizzas and Doner kebab right in the Bos en Lommerplein plaza. It is about 20 minutes on the bus to Amsterdam Centraal, which was just fine with us, because it means the hotel is nice and quiet. There is an open market in the plein a few times a week, which has good fruit and a lot of miscellaneous items. There was free high-speed internet in the room, but depending on your platform if you close your browser, or your computer sleeps, you have to enter the password again. No biggie, but a minor pain. If you are staying for a long time, there is a laundry a few blocks away (the Strijkerij) that will wash and fold your clothes for a reasonable fee, much cheaper than the per-item cost of the hotel laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: TeamGilbert
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located pretty far out of city center but does have tram/bus stop right there. Hotel was clean but the staff was not helpful. they only gave us 2 towels for 3 guests on the first night then took all the towels but one for our next night. The towels were also Motel 6 quality. They replaced used coffee cups but not the coffee or tea. Disappointing overall for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location but good if you are driving”
Reviews.Author: monalove2000
Reviews.Content: Great room but slightly disappointed in the location as it is not as near to the town centre as the hotel makes out, and I certainly couldnâ€™t figure out where the views of the city were to be seen from (as advertised). Otherwise, the room was very comfortable and in reality it is not too far out of town by public transport. Also if you are travelling to Amsterdam in a car, this is a good call as there is a secure garage next door. There is also a shopping centre next door which was good for buying bits of food for our onward journey.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: cityslicker09
Reviews.Content: my husband and stayed at his hotel for four nights,staff were the most friendly and pleasant i have ever came across,nothing was a problem breakfast was excellent ,a wide choice cold or hot buffet .rooms were spotless my only complaint was the menu in the restaurant could have been more extensive for following traveller's a little tip go to amsterdam central station and get the 21 bus to hotel,it stops right outside the hotel the trams and buses provide a excellent service to the traveller. a trip to brussels and antwerp are a most so go enjoy amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: uselessguy
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel and liked just about everything about it. The room was well furnished and the beds nice and soft. Bathroom was well done up and the bath was nicely sized as well. Yes location wise its a bit far from the main city center but a quick tram ride or bus journey will get you there in under 15 mins. We bought the full day passes on either tram or bus so it wasn't that expensive. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast in the morning quite good. We only faced one issue with our laundry where the staff did little to help us find the missing laundry which we only got back the day before we left.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when you are in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mickey_cruisin
Reviews.Content: Happy again with another stay at a Best Western Hotel. Yes this hotel is a distance from the city center but it's really not that bad when you consider the near by bus stop and trams across the street. At least it's quite and check in was good and fast. I like the fact that you have a few mini mart type grocers near the hotel just in case you need snacks or other things. This is Europe and things can get pretty expensive over time. My friends and I really enjoyed this place and will probably book here again the next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel everything you could want, I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: cindyazure
Reviews.Content: Having just come back from a fantastic stay in Amsterdam, I would certainly recommend this hotel the reception staff were so friendly and helpful, the room was very clean, spacious, the beds and pillow were very comfortable, tea & coffee in the rooms and also there is air conditioning. We had a breakfast included in the price which I have to say was fantastic a good choice of fresh fruits, yogurts, cereals, cold meats a hot breakfast of tomotes, scrambled eggs and bacon, a large selection of breads and rolls. if I were to say a down side it is a little way to the centre where all the main attractions are but there is local trams just around the corner and buses which run very frequent. We got a 5 day pass from reception which cost 18 euros it was for all the local transport it worked out alot cheaper then paying daily. It is useful to get a map from the reception as it tells you all the local bus numbers. The trams stop around 12ish however there is a night bus which we caught from Dam square around 3ish.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: doonhamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue Tower 26-29 March 2009. Although about 2.5km from Dam Square tram stops only 50m away and is 2.4o euro every 15 mins direct into the city. Clean modern hotel . Nearby there are a few bakers and convenience stores but not may formal restaurants. I would recommend the hotel. Staff very friendly. Rooms spacious and well furnished

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but a little far out.”
Reviews.Author: kissmecath
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here in feb, for a weekend birthday break. It is a little far out and on the bus to get there I did have a little panic that we were staying miles from anywhere. But once we got used to it, its not that far 15 / 20 mins on tram to the centre. Check in was hassel free, and reception is very nice with helpful staff. We were given out key card and directed to the lifts. Room was very nice, and plenty of space. Flat screen tv, very comfy bed ( was like sleeping on a cloud ) and very nice bathroom. The wardrobe was a little on the small side, 2 girls on a weekend away.. tight squeeze, but was fine. There is a kettle with tea & coffee in the room, but no milk? so i just took it from breakfast. We had the breakfast, and that was once again very nice, no complaints at all. ( ok, 1.. would have liked a sausage ) We did not have any noise from other guests. We were going to eat in the resturant one evening, but the menu was not to our taste and quite limited. There is a market and shops just outside the hotel, or as i said 15 / 20 mins from city centre. Only complaint was that it states there are 24hr snacks availible from reception, and after returning late one night we tried to get something to eat and they had nothing, not even a bag of crisps!! Be prepared to spend in Amsterdam, as it is very expensive, 15 Euros for 2 beers!! And that was a good deal. 12 Euros for 2 cokes!!! Taxi from Rembrant Sq to hotel is 18 euros. Which you have to do if your returning late as tram stops at 11.30pm. Great City, and Great Hotel, but take lots of cash!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KezzyLondon
Reviews.Content: Returned last week from our stay in Amsterdam and the Blue Tower Hotel, we've stayed in some dives in our time and this was quite a luxury hotel to us. Bathroom was extremely clean and well decorated, and toiletries provided although we did not realise this and bought our own so never got to enjoy those. The bedroom was nice, lots of dark wooden furniture but pleasent enough. Flat screen TV with MTV and occasional english for you to enjoy! Reception staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, there had been a problem with our booking via Hotesl.nl and we thought we had book 2 x Triple rooms which apparantely don't exist in this hotel but they happily gave us 2 x double rooms at the same price. On a few occasions our key cards became demagnetised because we'd stored them near our phones and reception were more than happy togive us new ones. Further to this they got us a great cab deal for our journey to Schipol airport which was practically half of what we had paid on the way there. It's a bit out of the way but there's a tram link over the road, Number 14 goes to the centre where all the actions at!

Reviews.Title: “Average, good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: PilarBravo
Reviews.Content: I was in the Best Western Blue Tower hotel during a business travel. The room was pretty small, but clean. The location is not very good, but for business travels is not so bad. The worst of my stay there was that the cleaning woman entered into my room without my permission while I was sleeping (at 7 AM) to clean my room. I told her to go, and an hour later, while I was having a shower, she tried to enter again (this time I had locked the door). She kept knocking at my door while I was preparing to go to work, and she was very angry with me when I opened the door to tell her not to disturb me... And she was shouting at me to put the "Do not disturb" sign in my door. Never seen something like that. That evening, when I returned, a mirror and part of the shower were removed from my bathroom. If you go there be sure that you put the "Do not disturb" sign in your door!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: rtfriends
Reviews.Content: I was warned that it was away from the city centre. My check in was handled reasonably smooth and the room was a decent size. The staff were very courteous. There is a market place on the other side but this does not cause any disturbance. The tram stop is just across the road and most of the sites are accessible quickly. A tram card is an important asset in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star as claimed”
Reviews.Author: chris_bEngland
Reviews.Content: At first I was quite impressed with the hotel on the inside, reception is nice and the furniture in the rooms is of good quiality, but im afraid thats where it stops. From my 5th floor window I have a beautiful view of someones flat balcony. Which I had to get to by stairs most of the time as the lifts were not working. From about 8am every morning you will get housekeeping knocking on your door UNTIL they wake you up... if I wanted my sheets changed I wouldnt be asleep in them would I? Very annoying part of the stay and also what pushed me to write this review. Dont bother with the cooked breakfast, there is no variety (3 items) looked disgusting too so I didnt try it, and im a man who loves his fry-up. The heating/air-con in the room did work, but for some reason takes 30 mins to put out any warm air after you turn it on. The Hotel lacks on facilities more than I thought it would, no currency changing, proper bar, or anywhere to get food or drink at night. You just got the reception, breakfast/eating area and rooms. I would say this is no more than a 2 star hotel disguised with some fancy furniture. Buyers please beware, spend a few extra quid and get something closer to the center otherwise you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more from a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: holidayaholic35
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam with my boyfriend in September for a 3 night get away break. Upon arrival we were checked in by a very friendly and helpful receptionist. She explained everything to us in detail about the amenities in the hotel and was very patient when giving us directions to the tram line and bus stops. The room was fantastic, the beds were so comfortable, I had read previous reviews who said the walls were like paper. I did not hear anything from the rooms next door except the showers going in the morning. The only downside was the tv channels most of them were dutch and the ones that were in english were news channels. We did pay extra for the movie channels but the selection was very bad and all of them except 1 turned into adult channels late in the evening. Breakfast was not included in our package but we did go have breakfast one morning, it is a buffet breakfast and the choice of food is excellent well worth the â‚¬12.50, we were set up for the day. The hotel is 10 minutes away from Dam square and the tram line is a stones throw away from the hotel and it was only â‚¬11 for a weekend ticket for unlimited use of the trams and buses in the cities.

Reviews.Title: “welcome to the blue box”
Reviews.Author: DublinBilko
Reviews.Content: basic hotel no bar miles out of town made bereable by cilla most helpfull girl from dublin . not some were i would stay again stayed friday to monday not one sheet change . walls so thin you can here next room goin to the toilet not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Shame about the neighbours”
Reviews.Author: zeusch
Reviews.Content: First the positives, and there are a few, which enable my overall rating of average for this hotel: 1.Blue Tower is adjacent to the tram and bus stops, which take you direct into Amsterdam centre. They even sell tickets at the reception (eg â‚¬7 for a 24 hour citypass in 2008). 2.Accommodation prices are cheap for a 4* rated hotel close to the centre. 3.Rooms are spacious and well equipped. 4.WLAN is free 5.Public parking garage adjoins the hotel, and, if you leave before the attendant starts work, it is free, otherwise â‚¬6 per day. 6.Some wonderful eateries and cafes are nearby. 7.Very handy for access to airport, without traffic jams. Now the negatives: 1.Sound-proofing is poor between rooms. Although not kept awake by "audible friendliness" of adjacent rooms, the keys turning in the doors certainly echoed when opened or closed. 2.Local residents are victims of night time car racing.It was possibly a one-off, but the pre-dawn (3am) chorus of tyre screeches was a form of Amsterdam nightlife I could have done without (although once awakened, the visual spectacle of waiting to see a crash was entertaining if not ultimately disappointing) 3.Night/early morning receptionist wasn't the brightest spark. When checking out at 7am to catch a flight, although polite, he was easily distracted, starting tasks for anyone who shouted, before completing service for current queuing customers. In his defence he complained that he had not slept all night!! (Certainly in my days of working night-shifts, that was always the point) In summary, if you will be awake all night anyway (or drunk), and not in a hurry to check-out, then location price and quality of facilities are top notch. If you want a night's sleep and an efficient departure, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Could be very better, little things make difference”
Reviews.Author: ricardo_papa
Reviews.Content: I read the critics about Best Western Blue Tower, in Amsterdam, and yet reserved this hotel. In the check-in, I and my wife were located in the 11th floor, that has no elevator, as well the 12nd floor. You have to pick your luggage all alone, because thereÂ´s no employee to help. I claimed and we were located in the 10th floor, no problems. The window was stuck and did not close at night, and both nights we stayed the problem remained, until 11:30 PM. The furniture was very dusty when we arrived, the other got better. Safe box was also stuck inside the furniture, with a nail blocking the door. However, breakfast was good. Despite being distant of the city center, you can reach a bus stop in the same block, with a very efficient public transport. By cab, we reached Central Station within 14 minutes (itÂ´s necessary explain to the driver if you are in a hurry, so go through the ring). In the day we arrived, the reception clerk gave us an indication about a night club completely wrong, cause the club was closed. Good points are the borrowing of iron and the hot-water bottle in the rooms. No refrigerator in rooms, but there are machines in each floor (if you prefer saving, there are two supermarkets just walking the corner, open until 10 PM). In resume, the bad points were greater than the goods. I do not recommend Blue Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Travis11
Reviews.Content: Best way to reach the hotel from Schiphol airport is to go by train to Amsterdam Sloterdijk station, where you take bus 15 directly to the hotel. Although the hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam, it has good connections with public transport. The hotel service is helpful with good information at the front desk available. Room was confortable, but we had to navigate around a large support column right in the middle of our room! Excellent buffet breakfast to make all tastes happy. Watch out for added charges like pay TV, even if not used. Check bill carefully! Bottom line, I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not new..budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: texastart
Reviews.Content: My brother made reservations back in July of 2007 for 4 of us. We were staying one night and taking a river cruise the next day from Amsterdam. The website implies it opened in June of 2007 but it was obvious, the building was not new. Upon entering our rooms, we realized we had no a/c. We immediately tried the thermostat but the a/c would not kick on. Several calls to the desk but still no air. They said they had to turn it on from the desk...it was computerized or something. All we kept seeing on the thermostat was a flashing key. One of the clerks came up and said that sometimes it takes 10 to 15 minutes for the air to come on. Amsterdam was having a slight heat wave for May and it was in the high 80's outside and the windows could not be opened. We never unpacked, so we headed back downstairs with our luggage as we obviously couldn't stay without air conditioning. To be fair, a helpful young woman at the front desk was apologetic and called around to find us another hotel. She found rooms for us at the Bilderberg Hotel, which was only 10 dollars more and 100 times nicer. When the taxi driver picked us up from the Blue Tower, he told us the owner of that hotel only ran "budget" hotels and didn't spend money on them. You had to use a card to turn on the electricity in the room. The location seemed to be in a less than desirable neighborhood as well. The Bilderberg Hotel was wonderful...quiet, in the museum district and the a/c worked perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Potential”
Reviews.Author: mrsinclaire
Reviews.Content: We researched hotels in the Amsterdam area prior to our trip and based upon reviews, decided to stay at the Blue Tower. We noted lower level construction taking place on the hotel and specifically booked an upper level room. Upon arrival, staff informed us that only first floor rooms were available. We looked at this room, which was large, clean and modern, but found it unacceptable as construction materials/work were right outside of our window. We requested a change and somehow an upper level room became available. However, this room was hot (air conditioning could not be turned below certain temperature) and noisey (from air conditioning units on the roof above). We again changed rooms and were provided with a lovely, large, and clean room. Some problems presented, in that the safe did not initially work (batteries needed replacement), the shower was a bit off and room phone not reliable (unable to call other rooms and two wake up calls were not received). After a long drive to reach the hotel, we were tired and these were problems we just didn't need. A reasonable morning meal is offered, which is convenient especially on a Sunday when local stores tend to be closed. Staff were very helpful with our travel questions and affordable local public transportation to the center of Amsterdam is nearby. Secure car parking is not available, especially on a Sunday when a neighboring public lot is closed. The hotel has a lot of potential and in comparison to hotels we observed in central Amsterdam, is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: mayday2073
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Best Western Blue Tower hotel. Just a few minor problems. The room we had was large, had comfortable beds and a nice bathroom. It was very clean but I was not too impressed by the corridor which was quite dark and had a box of what I assumed to be broken kettles and a lamp in the them the whole three days we were there. The only thing I did not like about the room was the lack of effort in fixing or removing broken items such as a large lamp that leaned over the table in front of the bed and a faulty doorknob on the cost. Since this is a fairly new hotel the walls could have been more presentable around the lifts too; there was a lot of dirt on the walls and lift doors. Breakfast is great and you have a lot to choose from too. To get to this hotel you can take the train from Schipol directly to Amsterdam Sloterdijk station and from there take the number 15 bus too Bos en Lommerplein. Once you get off the bus turn around and you will see the large blue hotel building across the street from you. If you want to go into the city centre you will need to take another bus since this hotel is a little far out. The number 21 bus will take you directly to the city centre and Central Station in about 15-20 minutes. The buses are great for the location of this hotel. Also if you want snacks there are some great shops to the right of the front of the building. I would recommend this hotel with a good deal and especially if you want a place that is quite. Yes the area looks a bit run down but it's not what you think.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: seabass00
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked the hotel, because it is relatively new, and it seemed that according to reviews, there aren't any good hotels in Amsterdam. This hotel isn't in downtown Amsterdam, but in a residential section on the western side of the city, just behind Bos En Lommer square. During the day there is a large flea market in the square, but at night there is little activity. There are a few small grocery stores and restaurants a couple of blocks away if you want to grab food at night, and I felt 100% safe in the neighborhood. It isn't downtown, but the buses and trams can be picked up on the opposite side of the square and it's about a 10 to 20 minute ride to the Centrum depending on where you want to go. The hotel itself is very nice. By Amsterdam standards, it was reasonably priced and the rooms and bathrooms were immaculate. The bed was comfortable and the furniture was in great condition. The only knock I really had against the place was that the window in my room closed completely, but did not latch, and so on one very windy evening the wind was quite loud. The breakfast buffet is good but very expensive. Breakfast in Amsterdam isn't cheap no matter where you go, so I couldn't hold that against the hotel. I read some other reviews that stated the hotel staff were rude, but they were actually exceptionally nice. I've traveled quite a bit, and I've only been to one hotel in my life where the staff was more pleasant and helpful than here. Bottom line: Prices are reasonable, it's out of the way location is offset by the quiet neighborhood and the ease of getting to the Centrum, rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff is polite and helpful. You can do far, far worse than the Blue Tower in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Tara1984
Reviews.Content: After booking the hotel we were a bit nervous thanks to all the reviews. First impressions of the hotel were nice & clean. We checked in and were first given a twin room when we ordered a double - the receptionist was a bit snooty when i explained the situation but we did get our booked room. The rooms were nice & clean with everything you need. The first room we were in had a bath and a shower but when we changed rooms we only had a shower. Bad points: Our room had a pillar about 3/4 the way down the room making moving around one side of the bed a bit awkward. The TV never worked properly - we couldnt view our bill on the online systems and i would be wary about watching the free channels that you dont get accidentally charged for the pay channels. We had a problem with our shower - the first time it was used it leaked all over the floor. It was missing the rubber strip at the bottom of the door. We phoned to explain the problem and ask for towels to mop the water up. Eventually someone turned up and i explained the problem and she said that maintence would fix it the next day (this was at 6PM). We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and it was never fixed. We thought the area was ok but our taxi driver on the way to the Airport advised that it wasnt.

Reviews.Title: “Wound up there by mistake...”
Reviews.Author: msgoodygoody
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam in a group of 12 we had arranged to stay at a hostel. However due to an unavailability with the rooms we booked we were all transferred by the hostel to the Blue Tower and it was a wonderful surprise having expected to be staying in a hostel we would up at the brand new hotel. There were a few problems as it had just opened. My partner and I were given the key to a hotel room which was already occupied. The power was off so we had to carry our luggage up 6 flights of stairs, the air-con wasnt working and they had no fans left to give out. Though fortunately we were not in the hotel much so it wasnt too much of a problem. I found staff friendly and the breakfast was good. The rooms were nice as were the bathrooms. I think the group would like to stay somewhere closer to the centre if we were to visit again as the 20 mins in and out of central Amsterdam ate into the day a little...

Reviews.Title: “Area??”
Reviews.Author: rothieScotland
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip via KLM including car hire. Read the other reviews and to be honest found the hotel itself not to bad. Sailing close to being called three stars though! No coffee or tea service in place. Only doing it the week we were there when it's been open nearly a year? No instructions for the safe and no indication as to cost - didn't ask. Room was pretty good even though we got one with a pillar in it. Bit odd. Nice and warm and clean despite other peoples views. Staff were very helpful overall and answered all questions and helped us out when needed - more to follow! Hotel boasts free wireless broadband in all rooms!? I managed to connect once in the room :-( Every time no problem in the lobby area - once in a week in the room. complained various times and they offered a room swap but not worth the bother as it was a pleasure trip. Different matter if on business. Parking!! Now there IS a problem. There is a parking garage next door but its only open 7am to 10pm, Mon to Sat. Out with those hours it's on the street and therein lies the problem if you have a car without Dutch plates. Our first hire car had German plates. Parked one night there and had two windows broken. Nothing lost as nothing left in the car. Only German registered car in the car park! Swapped it out for a Dutch registered car and had to use that car park another night. Sweated buckets over it but in the morning it was alright. Unlike the only German registered car parked there! it had been broken into. Not the hotels fault and they were really helpful with calling the Police. Unfortunately they were as bad as the UK police and could only make us an appointment to go and see them! better things to do on holiday - thanks. I would use this hotel again but not first choice. More central to town would be better although the bus and tram links are ok. if you do use it and get a hire car - make sure it's Dutch registered

Reviews.Title: “DUFF witha capital D”
Reviews.Author: WendywooWendywoo
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room and a double room for my brother and his girlfriend. The double room was ice cold, dirty and to make matters worse the staff were downright rude all for 129 Euro. The dutch reception staff were openly insulting us in Dutch, not realising that my sister in law is Dutch. We complained calmly and were fobbed off with regards to the heating. My brother and his wife had to complain again at 1am as they could not sleep for the cold. The night receptionist tried to argue that the heating was working but this was untrue. All we wanted was a clean warm place to put our head own for the night but this hotel could not offer this. We visit Amsterdam about five times a year but feel we cannot return to this establishment until they give it a clean, replace the reception staff and bump up the heating

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_UK
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Amsterdam. Stayed at the Blue Tower Hotel for a week (business trip). The hotel is new and quite nice. Beds are comfortable, bathroom clean and nice looking. Breakfast buffet costs 12 EUR and there is pretty good choice of food, although after a week I had enough (eggs, cheese, ham, jam, rolls, bread, milk, fruit, etc.) What I didn't like was the area! I didn't feel safe coming back to the hotel after dark. There are no restaurants in the neighbourhood (except of KFC and kebab). Staff is very friendly and helpful. RAI can be reached with one metro (10 mins walk) withing 25-30 minutes (ticket costs EUR2.50) or by taxi (ca 20 EUR).

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: efcog
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decently priced and so my expectations weren't very high. Upon arrival in Amsterdam, I was right to think so. The rooms have faux luxury furniture. If you look closely, you'll notice how cheap it really is. I think IKEA has better furniture than what is used here. The beds are nothing more than 8 inch thick pieces of foam. There is no real back support, so if you are someone who needs a good bed, then stay away from this place. The windows in my room did not open and close correctly. The window hardware seemed shody and I guess the hotel staff didn't care to fix this. The Air Conditioning did not work at all. The thermostat looked operational, but upon adjusting it, we noticed the room did not get any cooler. On a warm to hot day, this made the room unbearable. I asked the front desk and they said that the A/C was broken and proceeded in blaming the A/C company for not committing to a day for fixing it. I guess there's only one company that fixes A/C systems in Amsterdam. The staff was unknowledgable and though somewhat friendly, they didn't seem very sincere. When asking for directions, they seemed to get irritated when we asked them to repeat street names. I'm sorry, but we don't all speak Dutch and the street names are fairly difficult for native English speakers, especially when someone says the street name fast. At 3am one night the Fire Alarm went off. Everyone headed downstairs for safety. There must have been 150 people waiting around in their pajamas in front of the building. Not once did any hotel employee come to give us a status or what was going on. After waiting a good 20 min in the cold, people decided for themselves that it was a false alarm and headed back in. Still- no employees giving directions or guidance. If you are more concerned with budget than having a nice play to stay then I suppose the Blue Tower Hotel is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Dont judge a book by its cover!”
Reviews.Author: cheleb
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and thought we'd got the wrong place as the outside looks nothing like the pictures on their website. However the interior is lovely with marble floors and beautiful fittings. It looks more like a 4 star than a 3. The bedrooms are first class with granite bathroom tops and mahogany furniture. The showers are fantastic. I think it was an old office suite or something before. Dont expect anyone to know where you are asking for as its brand new and even people in the area don't know about it. Its tucked away at the back of the Bos en Lommerplein square. Theres lots of building new apartments and stuff going on but you dont get bothered by noise and it is a very smart area with plenty of shops and food outlets. The hotel is situated about a 15 minute bus ride (no. 21 to and from centraal station) or tram ride (no. 14 to and from Dam Square) from the central area of Amsterdam but the transport in the city is excellent. Get a 1, 2, 3 or 4 day transport ticket from the GVB office at centraal station; its good value. They were putting the finishing touches to the place when we were there so it should be A1 anytime soon. Excellent, friendly service at the desk too but we never had a problem so I cant comment on how they deal with issues but they were very helpful with everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “A tax office that is not yet open!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PIGGINSPRING
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to amsterdam, booked blue tower in March 07, through easy to book.com. On arrival in Amsterdam, we got our transfer to the hotel, our taxi driver looked at us a bit strange when we gave the address, but as it was a new hotel, we thought nothing of it, got to the hotel address, and it resembled a building site, no where near completed! infact our driver informed us only one month ago the place was a tax office, we managed to contact the hotel, who had made us another booking at a hotel further out, and, to be honest not somewhere i would have picked to stay. IF YOU HAVE A BOOKING AT THIS HOTEL, I WOULD ADVISE YOU TO PHONE THEM TO MAKE SURE IT IS OPEN, IF THEY OFFER YOU A DIFFERENT HOTEL, CANCEL AND BOOK YOUR OWN!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Blue Tower Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Leeuwendalersweg 21, Amsterdam 1055JE, The Netherlands
